author: {'steamid': '76561198028354069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 15935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11165, 'last_played': 1692201092}
review:
Thea 2 is an immersive survival game with great art, atmosphere, and gameplay. If you like imagination fodder and aren't familiar with Slavic folklore, pick this up right now and soak up some amazing fantasy you never knew. 

I played the first Thea and enjoyed, but never managed to beat it. The sequel is much better in my view because the devs opened up modding and the community took advantage of it. With some of the mods on offer you can make the game as relaxing or hard as you want, or shift the playstyle more towards survival, sandbox, or power gaming. You also don't have to be a genius to understand the event editor built right into the game, so if you don't like an event you can turn it off -- or change it to something closer to your liking.

I'm coming up on 200 hours and plan to keep going, and have beaten it twice, an achievement for someone like me who prefers to putter along and try every option, and who likes to gather an obscene amount of materials. Try it out, and you too can sit upon mountains of vegetables and heaps of rubies as the gatherer overlord.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019599257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1620062811}
review:
Just scratched the surface but having fun so far.

I like that it tells you the result if you were to auto-resolve a combat, and then you can decide if you're happy with it, or if you'd rather fight it manually (or forfeit it with some penalty).

It has permadeath by default but you have lots of difficulty settings you can adjust at the start, and one is to allow manual saving, so you can choose to allow reloads.

I find myself reloading when one of my favourite characters die, not because I like to cheat, but because I raised them from childhood and have got attached to them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024203315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1681164526}
review:
One of the best lesser known games I've played. The quality of this game is as good as you would expect from a AAA title, but with quarter of the price and free dlcs. Basically, its a mix of battle brothers and civilization. You pick a god, your starting party and venture the world. 

PROS:
-Great storyline, a lot of side quests,
-Ability to pick your playstyle: you can build a settlement, or choose a life of an adventurer. 
-Lots of content
-Fun, card game based fights
-Variety of classes and races to pick for your party
-Price
-Free DLCs
-Coop !
-Artstyle, especially the character images.

CONS:
None really. 

Its a big step forward from the first thea. They changed combat, in my opinion for better, its less rng and more fun. Other than combat its almost the same as Thea 1, but with more content in every part of the game. For its price, its a 10/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078985169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1617798265}
review:
My review is based on comparing this game with the first Thea, so my opinion of it is influenced by it.  For someone who never played the first one, overall experience may differ.

I really wanted to like this game.  I quite liked the first part, but it had a few things that needed improving, so my hope was that the sequel will provide all those improvements and more. It didn't happen. In fact, it feels like it went backwards.

The beginning of the game is quite a slog, where you are stuck with only a few party members roaming around (in original you had one expedition going and one already settled village). You have option to found a village, but you will be able to do it quickly only with basic materials which won't provide you good bonuses. On top of this, limited party members mean limited carrying capacity, so lot of the harvested materials and loot may end up going to waste.

There are other factions to encounter (an improvement to the original), but getting them to friendly terms (relationship of 50+) takes a lot of time, by doing missions for them, which so far involved eliminating different threats (beasts or robbers). Sometimes there is a peaceful option to do it (bribing), but it will cost your resources.  Other than improved relationship, the factions don't seem to offer any other rewards. I managed to get one faction to 47 relationship and they stopped giving me missions. It said I needed friendly relations at least to be able to recruit people from their village, so stopping at 47 is quite frustrating.

The battles are different than the original (still play as card battles), and actually preferred how they were done in original. But this could be just my personal thing.

UI is not very good. I don't know how difficult it is to move the world view by moving mouse to the edge of the screen, but lot of games seem to have it, so it couldn't be that difficult. Using WASD or arrows for a game that should be played mouse only is ridiculous.  Also, there is no option to go back in some dialogues, where there should be one. For example, in a village, if you go to a tavern, it gives you option to gamble (so far I've lost every single time) or drink (lowers your skills for up to 4 turns), but there's no option to leave.

To top it all, there are bugs. Reloading the game will sometimes result in losing the location of the current mission.  Sometimes, mission won't give you location to go to. In one village, there was an option to purchase a spider (fights as party member) or a cat (a familiar - gives bonuses when "equipped"), but clicking each option got me to the trading screen with no spiders or cats available.  The options should be disabled until those are available.

I got the game on a good sale, and it was even cheaper, since I had the original (completing a bundle on a sale), and that's the only way I recommend anyone doing it if you want to give it a try.

Edit: Fixed a few typos, didn't change anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005194478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2628, 'last_played': 1616112461}
review:
Don't be fooled by the recent reviews that say "mixed"... I have a feeling that's there because there really hasn't been an update for over a year.  In today's day and age, when pretty much games from 4-5 years ago are still supported with updates, some probably are not a fan that there hasn't been anymore updates, but this is a complete game :). 

So, if you've played Thea: The Awakening, then you'll feel right at home, almost everything I feel has been improved upon for the better. Now some may say the Combat in Thea was better, but I don't know, I prefer the combat of Thea 2 more. It's more easier to control the flow of battle unlike the first game which I found it difficult at times. Now If you're new to the game and never played the first, think 4x type like Civ game that gives that one more turn feel for sure, but with more of better touch of a game like King of the Dragon Pass since we have a lot of story driven events and all that fun stuff. 

The game can also feel grindy for sure, especially with the gathering and crafting, but with the help of 2 free DLC size expansions to add more events it helps a ton with the grind and you really don't feel it because you want to see what the next event could be as you adventure on, heh. The music is also very good as well which helps the immersion :).  You also have a lot of options to customize your difficulty which is a big plus and of course there is mod support which the first game didn't have. (Shout out to More Portraits and Building Overhaul mods, as those are my favorites and also the most popular too, so eventually I do recommend to get those 2 down the line)

I could go on and on, but honestly wanna get back to playing, so that I will. I do hope one day we see a Thea 3, or perhaps a similar game but in well-known lore setting like Ancient Greece or Norse Mythology from this group so it can sell a lot better because truly the Devs deserve the support :).

author: {'steamid': '76561199110130134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14841, 'last_played': 1615125866}
review:
总体来说不推荐购买，理由如下几方面：
一、战斗系统过于复杂繁琐，反而不如一代直接。
二、探险和建设部分拖沓枯燥，并且加上诸多限制——负重、天气、季节、地形，经常是几十个回合就在原地，枯燥无聊。
三、任务和事件单调乏味。主线任务就那么一个，支线任务也就几个，随机事件毫无预兆也没什么道理。本以为选择不同的神祇会有不同的情节，事实证明根本没有这么回事。
四、画面表现上比一代也没有什么飞跃，美工还是业余中的业余，立绘除了一代的单色换成了彩色，依旧是丑得一塌糊涂。
五、MOD以及创意工坊并没有太多精彩内容，除了换换立绘增加点随机事件之外，根本无法弥补作品本身的苍白。
六、音乐方面也很诡异，背景音乐听久了就会烦躁，这种比较枯燥的游戏似乎应该配一点舒缓柔美的音乐，而不是弄成现在这样阴气森森。
总结而言，这只能算是一部完成度不高的作品，除了对着屏幕打瞌睡，就是放在库里吃灰。虽然我的游戏时间很长，其实大部分时间都是玩了一会就索然无味挂机作别的去了。

author: {'steamid': '76561197980917160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13831, 'last_played': 1689801556}
review:
Прекрасная игра, по другому и не скажешь.
Разработчики оставили все лучшее, что было в первой части, и углубили многие аспекты.
Из-за этого, при кажущемся сходстве с первой игрой, вторая играется по-другому.
Там, где в первой части можно было лихим кавалерийским наскоком взять необходимые топовые ресурсы для крафта топовых вещей, во второй части нужно долго и тщательно заниматься крафтом.
Таким образом вторая часть получилась более размеренной и неторопливой, чем первая.
Боевая система тоже подверглась изменениям, стала сложнее и с большим количеством нюансов. К ней тожде надо привыкать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049790685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 20876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13788, 'last_played': 1673722150}
review:
なんだろうこの作品・・とても不思議だ。
ゲームバランス悪くて大して内容も詰まっていないのに定期的にやりたくなる中毒性がある(笑)

〇シリーズ１からの変更点
・村の位置が自分で決められるようになったのと2つ目の村が作れるようになった。
・村の中心施設を建設（改築）する材料次第で、村にいても収集できる範囲が広くなる（最大4マス）。

〇このゲームの魅力は村と村人の成長
ゲームの流れとしてはMAP上の好きな位置に村を作り、村周辺に落ちている素材を集めて道具や武器防具をつくりながら、敵から村や村人を守って発展させてゆくゲーム。

村自体も色々な建築物を建てることで村にとどまっている場合のみ戦闘や生産においてキャラクター達の能力を上げることができるため、強すぎる敵が近寄ってきた場合は村に逃げ込んで籠城（籠村？）することもできる。

また研究を進めないと建築物や上級の武器等作成できないようになっており、上級武器の素材も研究することによってMAP上に出現する。

村人の職業は大まかに採取人、鍛冶職人、戦士がいて他にもレンジャーや盗賊、魔法使いなど他多数。
レベルアップにより基本的にはそれぞれの職にあった能力が上がっていくが、たまに鍛冶能力ばかりが上がる採取人や戦士より力の強い盗賊とかに成長して役割がカオスな状態になることもある。

村人になる種族も人、ドワーフ、エルフ、オーク、ゴブリン、動物、ゴーストなどほかにも様々な種族がいて面白い。

〇このゲームの悪いところ
他の人もレビューで書いているが前作ではMAP上に落ちている素材で最強の武器防具が作れた。
しかし今作はMAP上最高素材に石炭を組み合わせ更に上の素材を作る。
MAP上最高素材４×石炭１で上位素材１ができる仕組みだ。
さらに煩わしいことにその作った上位素材より上の最上位素材があり、上位素材４×他属性の上位素材４=最上位素材１が作れる仕組みになっている。

最上位素材を大量に使用してしか最強武器防具を作れない為、無駄に時間がかかりターン送りがはかどるゲームになっている。
ラストボスも特に最強武器防具がなくても倒せる為、何のために最高素材が存在するのかもわからない有様。

また前作はターンが増えるにつれて鬼畜のごとき強い敵が出現したが、今作はそこまで強い敵が現れない。
前作より村や武器が強化できるようになった今作にこそ手ごたえのある強い敵が必要だと思う。

このゲームの最大の欠点はゲームバランスだと思う。
素材の変換率や敵の強さなどちょっとした変更で随分と評価がかわるのに惜しい作品だと思う。
と不満を言いつつも定期的にプレイしてしまう魅力があるのは間違いないが、購入者レビューを見ると数百時間費やしている人と数時間しかプレイしていない人に分かれるので、ハマる人はハマる作品なのかもしれない。

review:
[h1]Как испортить первую часть [/h1]
Плюсы: 
[list]
[*] Квесты. Некоторые являются продолжением квестов предыдущей части. В мастерской есть неплохая локализация (не полная)
[*] Орчья инквизиция (неожиданно!)
[*] Эльфы - любители детей и мужчин
[*] Можно грабить корованы
[*] Можно запузырить ребеночка орку-матриарху
[/list]
А теперь об отрицательной стороне:
[list]
[*] Часть квестов взята из предыдущей части. 
[*] Боевка. Так в ней и не разобрался. Дисбаланс в сторону воинов. Количество принимающих участие в битве ограниченно,  теперь это боль и автобитвы, дракона теперь палками не затыкаешь(
[*] Характеристики персонажей отвечают за все сразу и ни за что конкретно.
[*] Дисбаланс. Он раньше не блистал, но тут множество вещей стало еще бесполезней, включая постройки и специализацию персонажей
[*] Добавлено множество всякой ненужной фигни, отнимающей на себя время и внимания, усложняющей само восприятие игры
[*] Да где ж эти чертовы редкие ресурсы?
[*] Бесполезные животные, которых только и можно, что обменять (ага, на редкие ресурсы). .Прям как в Rimworld, только плохо. 
[*] Реиграбельности стало меньше
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198080323206', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3142, 'last_played': 1610963940}
review:
[h1]良くも悪くも「前作」の影がチラついてしまう作品[/h1]

『Thea 2: The Shattering』は、一部ではカルト的に人気を誇った作品である『Thea: The Awakening』の続編である。とはいえ、半分くらいはシステムや画像に使い廻しがあり、どちらかといえばリメイク的な印象を受けることもあり、また戦闘システムの大幅な変更によって、『Thea 1』からのプレイヤーはどうしても前作と比較して云々される作品になっている。

自分としては『Thea 1』はイマイチハマりきれなかったものの、『Thea 2』に関しては大いにプレイしやすくなっていて楽しめた。なので、今回のレビューは前作の比較というよりは、前作を含めた本作の魅力を語りたいと思う。

[h1]まず『Thea』（そして『Thea 2』）とは何か[/h1]

シヴィライゼーションシリーズに代表される六角形型のマス目上に、ユニットを動かしながら土地を探索し、クエストをこなしたり敵を倒し、場合によっては資源を集めながら、ユニットやら拠点やらを強化していく形のゲームである。

既存のストラテジーと違うのは、『Thea』には敵対勢力が存在しておらず、あくまでプレイヤーの勢力一つに特化していることだろう。そして主人公ユニットというのが存在し、このユニットが倒されて復活できなくなった場合、ゲームオーバーとなる。

従って、見た目は明らかに「ストラテジー・シミュレーション」ではあるし、一部そういう要素があるのだが、内容的にはあちこちにあるクエストをこなしたり、起きるイベントを楽しむといった「RPG」に近いものである。なので、勝利条件も「クエスト勝利」と、条件を三つ達成する「制覇勝利」というものが存在している。

この二つの組み合わせを独特の塩梅でミックスし、スラブ民話を下敷きにしたユーモラス・皮肉っぽさ。これらが『Thea』の魅力となっている。

[h1]『Thea』(そして『Thea 2』）の魅力とは[/h1]
[b]●独特のサバイバル感[/b]

『Thea』において、ユニットが移動するさいには「食料」と「キャンプ用の燃料」を持ち運ばなければならない。いくら探索中とはいえ、食料を切らせば飢え死にして死ぬし、温かい火がなければ疲れが取れず効率がガタ落ちする。イベントによっては唐突に食料やら燃料が無くなったりする。

これら食料や燃料が無くなりそうになれば、食料が取れるところで一度立ち止まって、食料を採取したりすることになる。これら食料は調理することができる。加工すると持ち運びやすくなる。また複数種類の食料を集めると、士気が上がり、様々なメリットを得ることが出来る。

こういった緩くリソースのバランスを取りながら、未知の世界を探検したり、あるいは自分の拠点を維持していくというのは、このゲームならではの魅力であると思う。

[b]●クラフトして強い装備を作る[/b]

装備を作るためには資源を発掘することができるのだが、それぞれの資源に関しては貴重度（Tier）が決まっている。良い資源を利用すればするほど、より強い装備が作れるようになる。また資源それぞれによって特化できる能力値がある。また、資源自体も掘り出すだけではなく、「石炭」を使うことによって、よりよい資源にまとめ上げることができる。

これら産出する資源から、よりよい資源を作ってどういう装備を作るか。あるいは遠方から資源算出組を派遣して、しばらく掘り出してもらってきてから装備を作るか。あるいは、使わなくなった装備を解体して資源にして、それらからよりよい装備を作る……といったように「どうやって資源を集めてきて、どんな強い装備を作るか」という楽しみがあるように思う。

[b]●スラヴ民話を下敷きにした皮肉っぽさ・ユーモラスさ[/b]

そのような「ストラテジーっぽいRPG」の作品は幾つかあるのだが、本作が人気を博したのは、恐らくスラヴ神話から来ている特有のユーモラスで、時には皮肉っぽいファンタジーの雰囲気にあるように思われる。

例えば、本作はそれぞれのユニットには名前がついており、村で徴兵して集めるといった類のことは出来ない。ではどうすればいいかといえば、イベントで手に入れる他に、「子供を手に入れて育てる」といった形でユニットを増やしていく必要がある。なぜ「子供を手に入れる」と表現したかというと、この作品、子供は「コウノトリ」が運んでくるか「キャベツ畑」で見つけるかのどちらかになるのである。従って、同性同士であっても、異種同士であっても平気で子供を見つけて来る。

さらには子供も成長していくと、途中の能力値に合わせて進路が決定されるのだが、たまに「取り換え子」という選択肢が出てきたりする。その選択肢を選んでみると、ワーウルフだったり、ネズミだったり、あるいはタツマキデーモンになったりするし、あるいは魔女にしようと送り出した子供が闇落ちしてアンデットになったりする。

[h1]本作であまりオススメできない部分[/h1]

とにかくRPGとストラテジー・シミュレーションの合いの子であるために、デメリットの部分もそういった「RPG」と「シミュレーション」の部分を引き継いでいる部分は大きい。

[b]●マイクロマネージメントの煩雑さ[/b]

とにかく細かい指示が必要になってくる煩雑さがあるのは間違いない。一例をあげてみよう。

まず資源を集めてくるために、ユニットに対して場所を指定する。そしてそのあと、重量がいっぱいになりそうなユニットを呼び戻すために場所を指定する。今度は余っている資源をよりよい資源にするための命令と担当者を決定をする。そしてそのあと、探索隊はまだ未知の世界へ行くための指定をする……。

もちろん、こういった煩雑さはシミュレーションゲームには付きものではあるが、『Thea 2』の場合はとにかく繰り返しになることが多くなるのが面倒くさいことになる。特に資源を加工しているときなんかは、様々なタスクを行き来させなければならず、そういった冗長な中間管理的作業が好きじゃない人は「こんなのやってられるか」となってしまう側面はあるように感じる。

[b]●賛否両論の戦闘システム[/b]

前作の特徴の一つといえば、マス目式のユニットぶつけ合いバトルではなく、そのカードゲーム的な戦闘システムであった。敵と戦うときは当然の事、イベントを解決するさいにも、課題を「倒す」ことによって、イベントを成功させるといったものになっており、これがいわば「前衛・後衛」の概念を持つ二段構えの戦闘システムというものになった。

この変更によって「前作よりもバトルが浅くなった」と言われることもあるが、しかしもう少し賛否両論の内容は根深い。それは「自動解決の利便性」の問題である。

利便性とはいえ、前作より今作のほうが遥かに使い勝手のいいものになっている。まず一つに、自動解決において結果がどれだけ良いもの（悪いもの）になるかということが事前に解るようになっている。圧倒的に良ければ自動解決にすればいいし、悪ければ自分で戦ってみることができる。

このゲーム、意外と戦闘（あるいはイベント解決）が多いので、この手の「自動解決が便利」というのはプレイする上で便利ではあるのだが、しかし同時に「自動解決が賢過ぎる（デメリットがあまりない）」ので、事実上せっかくの戦闘システムが骨抜きにされていないかと言われている。事実、自分も自動解決が便利過ぎて、戦闘を手動で解決することがあまりなかった。

[b]●一ゲームがあまりにも長すぎる[/b]

さて前作よりもある程度までボリュームは増えたものの、しかし勝利までの一ゲームが長いのは気になるところだ。特にこのゲームにおいてはリプレイが推奨されていて、ゲームの開始時に選ぶ神様であったり、あるいはそれらの神様が持つ能力をアンロックするためのポイントを稼ぐためには、一ゲームを通してプレイしなければならない。

自分が初めて勝利したときは1000ターン以上かかり、だいたい15時間近くかかった。慣れてきたときでも700ターンほどかかる。他のRPGやらストラテジーと比べたら大したことないようにも思うけれども、さすがに中盤から終盤にかけては、ほとんどのクエストをやりつくしていたり、どこ行ってもやることが無くなってくるので、「あと一ターン」というよりかは「まだ一ターンある……」みたいな飽きがくることは確かだ。

とにかく負ける条件というのが基本「主人公のユニットが倒される」ということだったりするので、とにかく詰まるとダラダラと長引いてしまう傾向にある。これはストラテジーではなくRPGに寄せた部分の弊害にあるように思う。

[b]●日本語化が絶妙に面倒[/b]

これは本作に限ったことであるが、自分が日本語化しようとした際には、一部が文字化けしてしまって余り良くないことになってしまった。一方で前作はちゃんと日本語化できるので、そういう意味で敷居が高い側面はあるとは思う（自分だけの環境かもしれないけれども念のため）。自分は『Capture2Text』を利用して遊んだりしていた。

[h1]総評[/h1]

総評としては、前作において煩わしかったりした部分においてプレイしやすくはなっていて、前作はいまいちのめりこめなかった人でも十分に楽しめるポテンシャルはあるように思う。ただ、その一方でどうしても前作をやり込んだ人だったりすると、グラフィックが綺麗になったけれど物足りなさを言う人は少なからずいるだろうと思う。なので、前作から入るのも悪くはない気はする。

『Thea 2』は前作の衝撃というか、カルト的な作品であったが為に、どうしても前作と比較されざるを得ず、そういう意味ではポジション的につらい作品ではある。しかし前作を知らなかったり、前作は楽しそうだけどいまいちハマりきれなかった人は、この本作から始めても十分だと思う。体験版もあるしね。

とにかく色々と難があって文句言いながらも、結局やり続けてしまうファンタジーと神話の魅力に溢れている作品が『Thea 2』なのだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007505984', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 11677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1612761143}
review:
Lazy creation.  So much missing, even after so much time since release.   e.g. a basic legend to explain map icons or a 'pedia.  As somebody who played Thea 1, I understand much of what is going on, but a new player would be utterly lost.  What a waste.

Update:  My initial review essentially stands.  I played and enjoyed Thea 1, and didn't have a significant learning curve with #2.  The game is addicting, and I played quite a bit.  However for new players it would simply be daunting and not really worth the effort.  Did you like Thea 1?  Get this.  If not, avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1651304115}
review:
Это совершенно ужасно. В первую часть я хотя бы смог играть. Ужасный интерфейс, непонятный темп игры - уже только это мне не позволяет даже в самом начале понять - я вообще делаю что-то хорошо или плохо? Да блин, даже при выборе пола персонажа перед стартом игры - непонятно пол кого я выбираю... По интерфейсу вроде как должно быть для каждого персонажа в группе, а на деле наверное только для избранного (про что игра кстати вообще не говорит). Ну а что там с полом других персов - я так и не понял.

Да, что-то вероятно стало лучше - вот например я согласен, что в 1-й части было излишне много типов испытаний, и сокращение тут полезно.  Но вот уже новый вариант битвы... Оно и тогда было странно, но зачем менять шило на треугольное мыло - не ясно. Мне даже боевка 1-й части нравится больше, тут совсем какая-то странная фантазия, которую ведь придется переварить и принять.  

Прямо перед этим играл в Worshippers, и насколько все строго и понятно там - настолько безумно и неясно в Thea 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173176247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 12553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5125, 'last_played': 1684799309}
review:
After a lot of turmoil, I've decided to give this game my seal of approval. This is not Thea 1 and it will make your head hurt trying to compare the two. While there are similarities, you must abandon all hope of the old combat system and be thrust into a whole new experience. 

The combat is not easy to figure out at first. You will struggle and curse and swear that the old way was better. You will be wrong. It isn't better or worse. It is a completely new take and shouldn't be compared to the ways of old.

The full color details of the characters are great and the amount of variants your group will contain, is most excellent. Your ghost might mate with your warrior and create some form of an unliving creature. The fact that you can choose skills and map points while leveling is great too.

Like me, you might hate this game when first playing. You might just go back to playing Thea 1... But you will return to continue hating this game. Over time I've come to master the combat and greatly enjoy this game as a stand alone entry and not quite a sequel in many ways. 

Play it. Learn to love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012070982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1650514676}
review:
Thea is such a wonderful game to play. It has a calming and soothing effect on me. Just being sucked in to the world of Thea is a joy in itself, but the gathering, crafting and building are great too. 
Also the card based fights are cool, although I still have a lot to learn there.
The lore is presented via beautiful drawings and well written stories. 
I did play the first Thea and this is much the same in many aspects, just worked out better in my opinion. 
Once I get further in I might add to this review but the game already is worth every cent I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003541464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1669590873}
review: Thea 2 got everything like a 4X ... except an X since there is no expanse. It looks a lot like a RPG ... but not quite. It is some kind of roguelite since you earn points to spend for your next run at the end of one. So in the end I don't know what Thea 2 is, but I know what it is to me => an excellent turn based game and a good entry to 4X games if (like me) you struggle with those kind of games. There is a free demo, I highly suggest you try it.

review: The storytelling is very interesting, and the world is unique  Voice acting is interesting. The mechanics are drudgery.  The developer does not seem to care much about the tedium of resource gathering and the scaling math required to build useful buildings or items.  Movement is slow and tedious, and basic UI for looking at your groups and town needs better design - for a game based on resources and inventory, this is the core of the "game loop" and the friction here grinds the gameplay down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047842871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1700273100}
review:
Jogão jogão..
Gostei bastante do primeiro e a sequência foi justa. Demorei para entender como seria o jogo, concordo que o sistema de punição é muito maior nesse 2, entrar em desafios muito mais fortes sem pensar pode dar errado demais, gostei da melhora no sistema de construções e combate. Senti falta de alguns features do primeiro jogo como A possibilidade de atrair determinadas raças de acordo com os materiais usados na construção. Achei que esse jogo poderia ter expandido para a possibilidade de criar mais de uma vila - até pode-se criar uma segunda vila mas não instalar uma em cada ilha.
Achei algumas das quests repetitivas mas entendo que é dificil produzir tantas quests e resultados diferentes.
Acredito que para o próximo jogo pode ser criado um panteão de Deuses mais ligados a classes específicas, seria interessante. Também alteraria a dificuldade de encontrar materiais mais raros, no ponto que você consegue alguns deles seus personagens já estão fortíssimos. 
Vale a pena. Jogão daria um 8/10 .

author: {'steamid': '76561198091051783', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 5757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3328, 'last_played': 1649157897}
review:
[h1] Не могу долго в неё играть - сразу тянет колядовать! [/h1]
.................................[b] КОРОТКО: [/b]
Игра отличная; Прогресс есть относительно первой части; Затягивающая механика; Много интересных историй и квестов; Славянский фольклор; [strike]Межрассовое спаривание;[/strike] Чёрный юмор; Возможность перепрохождения.
-------
Игру рекомендую!
-------

.................................[b] ПОДРОБНО: [/b] 

[h2] Игра отличная? [/h2]
Да, лично мне она показалась именно такой. Конечно, у данного продукта есть плюсы и минусы, но это не умоляет её качества и оригинальности. Ниже я выскажу своё личное мнение, пытаясь быть максимально объективным.

[h2] Братья-разработчики [/h2]
Наши добрые соседи создали две части Thea, за что им низкий поклон! В продукте чувствуется огромная любовь к своему детищу. Каждый аспект, будь то диалоги или иллюстрации, преисполнен гигантской порцией труда и щепетильности.

[h2] Сценарий [/h2]
Я имею достаточный опыт в писательском деле (художественные книги, научные работы, сценарии для игр и кино), что позволяет мне по достоинству оценить всё текстовое и логическое наполнение игры. Как писатель я, безусловно, ликую[strike] сверкая голым задом[/strike]! Здесь вам и оргии русалок, и жертвоприношения детей, и бессердечный Дед Мороз с милой спутницей. Душа радуется от продуманных историй, так или иначе поднимающих незаслуженно забытую тему славянского фольклора.

[h2] Геймплей [/h2]
Радует вариативность. Вы можете достичь победы несколькими способами. Поставите ли деревню, или же будете вечными скитальцами с перегруженным рюкзаком, выкуете кольцо всевластие или потратите[i] божественные семочки [/i] на воскрешение избранного – выбор за вами! В прокачке персонажей и крафте тоже всё очень интересно. Но мне больше всего пришлось по вкусу вариативность решения любых квестов. К примеру, если у вас есть в отряде демон, то это открывает новые ветки диалогов, что может дать довольно приятные плюшки. А рождение детей? Ах, сумасшедший аист мне однажды принёс отпрыска дикой любви крысы и гоблина. А я-то уже думал, что Thea меня ничем не удивит!:)

[h2] Ценовая политика и аддоны [/h2]
Ещё с первой части заприметил, что разработчики бесплатно выкатывают аддоны [spoiler] (привет SEGA с их многочисленными аддонами к серии total war по стоимости основной игры!) [/spoiler]. Это действительно достойный поступок, когда вместо выкатывания дорогущих аддонов для полупустой игры, разрабы просто предлагают добровольный донат! Мои похвалы!!! (а ещё они постоянно фиксят и дополняют свои игры). Сама же игра определённо стоит своих денег!

[h2] Славянский фольклор для англичан [/h2]
В мире насчитывается более 300 миллионов славян. Из них примерно 200 миллионов являются русскоязычными. Банальная мат.логика кричит, что данному продукту нужна русификация, как воздух. Но не ругайте разработчиков! Им и так нелегко приходится! [spoiler] (лучше купите им пиццу). [/spoiler]
Нужно понимать, что большая прибыль для разработчиков игр приходит из богатых англоязычных капиталистических стран.
А силами многоуважаемых добровольцев был создан достаточно качественный русификатор:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1824477540
Лично проверил его – достижения не блокирует, не глючит, большую часть текста отображает на русском и без ошибок.

[h2] Минусы [/h2]
Никоим образом это не претензии. Просто попытка сформулировать словами то, без чего, как мне кажется, игра стала бы лучше. Список, от наиболее существенного к самому незначительному:
[list]
    [*]«Пустота» мира. Не хватает «жизни» на карте. Лишь монстры и редкие нейтралы. Хоть бы какие изменения ландшафта и постройка дорог была б...
    [*]Я ожидал больших изменений по сравнению с первой частью Thea. Хотелось бы больше нововведений и кардинальных изменений.
    [*]Отсутствие официальной русской локализации.
    [*]Игра для стратегии с карточными боями слишком требовательна к ресурсам.
    [*]Долгий запуск игры (загрузка всех библиотек требует времени, а если вы играете с модами, то будьте готовы до пяти минут пялиться на вялую шкалу).
[/list]
[h2] ВЫВОД[/h2]
Рекомендую приобрести игру и поддержать разработчиков любым способом, какой вы можете себе позволить! Ребята действительно этого заслужили! Игра ламповая и проработанная. Спектр возможностей поражает.
Для тех, кому чего-то не хватает, либо чувствует однообразие, рекомендую следующие работы из мастерской:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1824945461
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1783054290
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775901663
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1812005719
-------
[b]Игрокам приятной игры, а разработчикам – успеха и вдохновения![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198031007613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 16468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4201, 'last_played': 1697377250}
review:
Vorab schonmal, ich liebe dieses Spiel. Es steckt einfach so viel Liebe zum Detail in allen Facetten.

Worum geht es: Im ersten Teil https://store.steampowered.com/app/378720/Thea_The_Awakening streift man mit einer kleinen Gruppe durch eine slawisch inspirierte Welt und versucht diese vor dem Verfall zu retten. Thea 2 spielt einige Generationen später. Die Welt Thea ist noch immer in Gefahr zu zerbrechen und wieder ist es am Spieler und einer kleinen Gruppe, die Welt vor dem Untergang zu bewahren.

Das Spielprinzip ist ein faszinierender Mix aus 4x Strategie, Erkundung, Rollenspiel (die Charakterentwicklung ist ein wesentlicher Spaßfaktor - und man zieht im Laufe der Jahre Kinder groß, die zu neuen Helden werden) und Kartenspiel. Man könnte denken, dass das Spiel hierdurch überladen wird, aber das Gegenteil ist der Fall: Die Elemente passen natlos zusammen und gerade der Kamp mit Karten gibt dem ganzen noch eine besondere Note. Ich bin so zufrieden mit dem Spiel, dass ich es dieses Jahr 3x an Freunde verschenkt habe...

Ein paar Dinge gibt es zu bemängeln:
1) Bei funktioninierte das Demo nicht! Das Spiel läuft bestens - das Demo nicht :(
2) Das MuHA-Team hat hier etwas ganz eigenes geschaffen - und so fühlt sich das Benutzerinterface an einigen Stellen auch etwas eigen an. Manche Einstellungen kann man nur auf bestimmten Bildschirmen treffen oder ansehen. Und die Verwaltung verschiedener Gruppen kann zu einem Mikromanagement Marathon werden. Das ist nur wirklich wichtig, wenn man als Spieler das Meiste herausholen möchte, aber manche Spieler werden sich am UI stören.
3) Es gibt eine Einstellung für Interaktion von Teilgruppen über Entfernung. Dies ist zwar nicht logisch und macht das Spiel einfacher, ABER JEDER SOLLTE IMMER mit 3-6 Kästchen Interaktionsradius spielen, weil es das Spiel sooooo viel angenehmer macht. Wer's schwerer haben will setzt die Zahl der Startcharaktere herunter und die Monsterentwicklung hoch...

Fazit: Ein wunderbares Spiel 5/5. Was mir besonders gefällt ist die Grafik, und die Art wie 4x Strategie und Rollenspiel miteinander verwoben wurden - es gibt quasi kein anderes Spiel, welches diese Erfahrung bietet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112287122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13152, 'last_played': 1704715200}
review:
I love this game, I enjoy the turn based strategy layers and the different styles of combat. 
You have to think about how to evolve and develop your characters. You need gatherers just as much as rough warriors. 
the mystics become the most powerfull later in the game, but with good crafting you can make a raw powercreature the back bone of your army. 

experiment, play, develop and start all over again. make a settlement or be a nomad. become friends of the light or give in to darkness. Multiple ways to finish the game, or atleast feel like you have finished. 

it is a game for people who like characterdevelopment and crafting. Gamers who are in for the long haul will be rewarded. people who enjoy fast pacing hack and slash games will be dissapointed. 

I don't know any other game like this. If you do please let me know...

author: {'steamid': '76561198211666463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 35947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1692535497}
review:
Mam co do drugiej odsłony tej gry mieszane uczucia.
Sporo minusów w porównaniu di jedynki, ale i kilka zmian na lepsze. Na poczatku gra mnie odrzuciła i musiało minąc sporo czasu zanim zacząłem dostrzegać jej plusy. Wymienie tu różnice na plus i na minus:

+ System reputacji u poszczególnych frakcji w grze.
+ Dzieci, ich rozwój i dorastania o niebo lepiej rozwiązane niż w jedynce.
+ Grafika, co tu dużo pisać, widać ogromną różnicę.
+ Zdobywanie punktów awansu i doświadczenia
+ Możliwość craftowania lepszych surowców z tych pośledniejszych

- Chamskie przekopiowanie słowo w słowo sporej liczby questów z części pierwszej.
- Udziwniony na siłę system walki. 
- Przedmioty możliwe do wyprodukowania. Około 80% jest całkowicie nieprzydatnych. Zwoje, relikwie, amulety, tarcze i wszelka jednoręczna broń w tej grze to śmieci. 
- Przekombinowana lista surowców. Za dużo tego, biorąc pod uwagę, że praktycznie różnice są niezauważalne.
- Niezbalansowana rozgrywka. Raz jest banalnie łatwo, innym razem team pada jak muchy
- Brak języka polskiego co jest po prosty skandaliczne biorąc po uwagę, że gra jest wydana przez polskie studio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035604033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8319, 'last_played': 1706382177}
review:
A great mix of Board Game, Card Game and RPG elements with a deeply rich setting and plenty of juicy slavic lore on the side. If you are a fan of fantasy strategy and RPG games, then this game is for you. It's great both in single player and multiplayer with friends (if you have any that is).

I particularly liked sharing various different food types between my village and the villages of my friends who all had their own unique resources to make different food from. 

Game also has a lot of modding potential as well as the ability to modify core game mechanics if some of them feel tedious to you.

There is even a massive free DLC for the game that adds so much more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034367523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 14857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1704287922}
review:
Je suis vraiment désolé de devoir refuser la recommandation de ce jeu, pour ma defense il m'a obligé.

Si l'ambiance possede toujours son coté bien sympathique ont y retrouve de la copie du premier opus à un niveau quant même fabuleux.

l'interface n'est pas au point, et pourrait être simplifiée facilement

quelques jolis dessins ont ne peut pas dire, saboté par le manque de logique rendant inutile les images des personnages.

l'arbre de technologies est assez simple et confus pour être désinteressant comme les combats assez confus aussi. Le manque d'explications rend ça barbant et finalement assez stérile.

dans ma premiere partie mon personnage faisait des enfants avec ses propres enfants... une fois grands évidemment. 
une de mes enfants s'est marié avec un rat géant.

En me baladant sans ville j'ai des evenements au pif de ville.
bref la gestion en plus d'être un peu trop laborieuse et confuse n'a que peu de sens.
certaines gestions comme la foi sont assez cassées et des morceaux ne sont pas entièrement expliqué ou ne contiennent pas les infos qu'ils devraient.

l'histoire ayant pas mal de copie avec le premier, reste assez moyenne voir moins. 
il manque évidemment un peu de designs . Et les copié collé des events du premier n'ont clairement rien à faire la.

Les musiques sont sympa mais ont ressent pas la profondeur qu'ont attend.

je vais continuer à pousser le jeu mais d'avance je le déconseille au dessus de 10 € ça ne le fait pas et désolé pour les devs mais ça se travaille un jeu, ont jette pas comme ça un peu tout sans liaisons .
Le jeu est raté.
Ont note aussi quelques bugs de plantage rares mais très aléatoires

Pour sa défense il est malgré tout plus rapide dans ses chargements que le premier qui était très mal programmé sur ce point.

Les dieux sont sympa même si pas plus interessants que ça. 
Le systeme de démarrage est assez confus et le jeu pousse surtout à ne pas se poser pour fonder une ville. Cela dit une fois posée et de nombreux ennuyeux tours passés presque rien ne peut vous déloger.

Les recherches et les batiments sont mignons et fades, c'est uniquement une affaire de tiers suivant. pas de travail sur ce point.
Une refonte serait une bonne idée.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 6790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 175, 'playtime_at_review': 4165, 'last_played': 1712246604}
review:
Okay, so after 68 hours I just finished my FIRST run. I am a ponderously slow player of most games, and I am sure others could do much, much better, but still. This game is meant to be replayed, and is kind of like the unlikely offspring of Civ, Heroes of Might and Magic and Choose Your Own Adventure games. 

First thing to say is it is a huge improvement over Thea 1 : The Awakening. It is a much more enjoyable UI, and I doubt I'll go back to Awakening simply because this feels like a superior game overall at this point. 

Second thing to say is that if you still do not enjoy this game's UI (after playing the Demo, which I recommend as it just lets you play the game for 100 turns, plenty to get a taste without risky the treaded '2 hour return window') fairly early on, then quit it and return. You will spend a lot of time in the games crafting, gathering, and cooking / composites screens, as well is the equipment and inventory screens. If you find those menus tedious early on, bail out ! 

The third and last thing I'll say is this game has so much replay value. After my first run where I 'beat' both main quests (Gosk's Might is HARD man, and the Arena is even harder!) I still had only encountered less than 15% of events in the game (it tracks). 

I will likely take a bit of a break before I start my next run, but I have a LOT of God Points to spend to unlock new options and powers, so I am excited to see the Roguelite components that were only slightly present in Awakening take their much better (and more fluid / transferable) form in this one.

8.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101442851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1605191902}
review:
Ceci n'ai pas une évaluation négative concernant la qualité du jeu et du studio mais plutôt un désaccord avec la direction prise par Théa 2 et selon moi, l évolution ratée de Théa1.
Aussi si vous ne connaissez pas ce jeu, je vous conseille fortement de commencer par le premier opus qui est véritablement enchanteur en terme de jeu de rôle/ jeu de gestion.
Si comme moi, vous avez déjà succombé au charme de Théa premier du nom, peut être que vous risquez d'être très déçu par ce second volet si les points qui suivent vous interpellent.

Points négatifs :
- Toujours pas de budget pour une trad ( c'est très dommageable là où la compréhension du texte est au coeur du jeu ). Merci à la commu d'en avoir traduit une partie.

- une interface non pas améliorée mais complexifiée, ce qui la rend difficilement compréhensible, alourdie. Beaucoup d'icônes, de sous menu, de stats à identifier. Là où dans théa1 il était facile de reconnaître en un coup d'oeil les spécialités et les états d'un personnage, là il faut ouvrir plusieurs onglets pour avoir l'ensemble des informations d'un seul personnage... 

- un survival laborieux. Si l'idée d'accéder à des tiers supérieurs de composants par le craft est une bonne idée pour se développer ou que l'on soit, rendre la récolte et le craft long à en mourir tue tout l'intérêt. Une bonne partie du jeu consiste à passer les jours car tous vos personnages sont sollicités à ses tâches pour espérer aller plus vite et on ne fait rien d'autres en attendant. Contrairement au 1, même l'exploration ne suffit pas a stuff avec les loots comparé à la progression des ennemis. vous DEVEZ craft de l équipement, donc vous devez récolter, craft et rester stuck à attendre des plombes...

- un système de combat assez obscure. La volonté d'améliorer le système de combat en ajoutant une stratégie de placement et la possibilité d'utiliser les points d'actions pour rejouer le même personnage aurait pus être sympa si on avait la sensation de pouvoir maîtriser cette mécanique. Mais là encore ce n'est pas clair, on a aucun indice sur les placements ennemis et le nombre de carte qu'il va dupliquer ou pas et j'ai eu souvent la sensation d'une résolution qui n'avait absolument rien à voir avec ma stratégie de départ. C'est pas noob friendly du tout, du coup j'en ai préféré le combat auto et franchement c'est bien dommage car les combats du 1 qui  étaient simples mais si plaisant que même un combat contre un rat ça se relevait avec plaisir. Là ça me fait suer et en plus j'ai pas le temps, j'ai de la récolte à faire tourner...

- Un multijoueur cassé par l'attente. Déjà le cas dans le 1, lorsque qu'un joueur était occupé, l'autre ne peut pas passer son tour. Ca n'aurait pas été un problème avec la même mécanique dans le 2, si le craft/récolte n'était pas si long et les combats si laborieux ! J'y ai joué à 3 et quand 1 joueur doit juste passer 6 tours pour son craft et que l'autre veut faire son combat et qu'au tour suivant c'est l'autre qui fait sa récolte et le troisième doit lire une quête d'un km. On passe son temps à s'attendre les un les autres...Là aussi , il y aurait à redire car le bonheur d'avoir un multi, gaché par sa propre mécanique de jeu, c'est quand même balot.

- Une évolution de Quête peu immersives. Ce n'est pas tant que les quêtes sont moins bien, c'est surtout qu'elles sembles très décousues, qu'elles popent sans raisons, sans fils conducteurs. C'est comme ci, on était sensé avoir toute la connaissance du premier opus et qu'il ne semble pas nécessaire de nous immerger petit à petit dans l'histoire du monde. "on est un élu, tu sais ce que c'est, il va arriver des trucs, démerde toi".

Voilà pour les principaux points qui ont fait que je n'ai pas réussi à m'immerger dans Théa2 alors que j'ai passé plus d'une centaines d'heure sur le 1. J'attendais de ce second opus un nouvel élan, une bouffée d'air frais à nouveau, mais j'y ai trouvé une complexification de quelque chose qui déjà marchait bien, un alourdissement mal venu qui m'a détachée très rapidement du coté jeu de rôle.

Pour les points positifs :

- Très belle qualité visuelle. La modélisation de la map est jolie et les illustrations sont magnifiques.
- Une bande son bien travaillée.
- L 'exploration un peu plus poussée avec le système de bateau.
- le mode nomade qui permet de craft sans village et qui permet de prendre son temps pour s'établir dans un endroit 'parfait' pour soi.
- le multi, parceque même si c'est chiant, à plusieurs ça l'est toujours moins XD.
- le système de faction qui donne de la vie à la map, je trouve.


En bref, y a du bon et du mauvais, mais encore une fois, je trouve le 1er bien meilleur dans sa simplicité, achetez le ! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197992690466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1605271697}
review:
Je n'ai pas aimé Théa 2 pour le moment. Je vais continuer à y jouer, on ne sait jamais mais pour le moment je le trouve moins bien que le premier.

Je vous fait une liste des point positifs : 
-On peut choisir l'emplacement de son village.

Et maintenant les négatifs :
-La coop est chiante ! Si, au début du tour, quelqu'un a une quète, on va devoir attendre sans rien faire. Pareil lorsqu'on a validé son tour ... C'est pas ergonomique, c'est bien que la coop soit disponible mais elle n'a pas été pensée pour permettre d'avancer efficacement, c'est pas fluide ... Soit on est tous d'accord et on passe le tour, soit non quelqu'un a besoin de faire quelque chose alors on se fait chier en attendant.

-L'interface est pourrie ! Les détails importants ne sont pas forcément mis en évidence, finalement mes gars s'appellent : Recolt, Artisant, Science, Guerrier... c'est ce que j'ai trouvé de plus simple pour savoir qui fait quoi. Parceque quand un membre du groupe prend un lvl par exemple alors on peut lui augmenter une stat et à ce moment tu ne vois que sa photo et son nom. Les ressources ont toutes la même apparence. Un cercle de couleur différent pour les tiers différents aurait été apprécié. 

-Si tu décides de faire ton village et bien ... Tu y restes. Voila, on oubli les expéditions pour 2 raisons :  La première c'est qu'il est extrèmement dur d'avoir de nouveaux arrivant, c'est ultra rare ! Donc tu ne peux pas te dire : "Je vais laisser 10 personnes au village qui travaillent et explorer avec une escouade de 7 personnes" Perso, le mieux que j'ai eut c'est 12 personnes ( Comptant des rats,des fantômes, des zombies et des citrouilles ). Vu l'importance de la récolte dans Thea2, ce n'est pas envisageable de ne laisser que 6 ou 5 personnes à la maison sinon il ne se passe rien ! Et le temps de dingue que ça met pour avoir un village "correct", je parle vraiment juste d'un truc qui tient debout, t'arrives déja aux tours 200+ et ça rejoint le deuxième point : L'investissement sur le village t'empêche d'avoir une expédition solide parceque tu ne peux pas tout faire ! C'est soit l'un, soit l'autre. Et du coup, on rejoint le premier point négatif : C'est chiant ! Parceque tu ne peux pas prendre d'initiatives alors tu attends que les tours passent ... Tu crafts des conneries et tu sais même pas ce que tu vas en faire finalement ... On se retrouve dans une situation où rien ne se passe ....

-Le charbon c'est casse couille voila ! Si tu veux obtenir des matériaux de meilleure qualité alors tu devras mettre en place une chaine de production. Déja, en soit le concept dépanne bien mais c'est relou parce que ça monopolise beaucoup de personnel. Cela dit, c'est mieux que rien. Le vrai problème c'est que pour transformer des matériaux il te faut absolument du charbon, pour tout ! Et vous savez comment on créé du charbon ? Je vous laisse deviner .... On en créé pas ! :D ! C'est soit t'as de la chance et y'a du charbon alors tu peux le récolter, soit non et ... et bien ... Si y'a pas de charbon t'es bon pour relancer une partie dans l'espoir d'avoir du charbon.

-C'est réchauffé ! Même les illustrations sont celles du premier ! Finalement y'a pas de nouveauté ou plutôt, il n'y a pas de nouveauté intéressante !

Bref ! Je suis vraiment désolé de mettre une revue négative mais je ne suis pas content ! Théa1 je l'ai adoré et je l'ai recommandé pour beaucoup, c'est pour moi une référence du genre ! Théa2 me gonfle, j'y joue qu'à moitié en regardant des conneries sur facebook à cotés parce que je m'emmerde. C'est pas intéressant, si mes personnages meurent je m'en fou. Je ne fais aucune rencontre intéressante, aucune histoire de quête ne suscite mon intéret ... Il est nul !

author: {'steamid': '76561198056293974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 80584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2321, 'playtime_at_review': 61364, 'last_played': 1712496554}
review: Very good game.  I played the original from early access to the last expansion and would go back and do the occasional play through because I loved it.  This sequel added more content while still remaining true to the original theme.  I played the original for 900+ hours before I got this game and now I've played this one 1,000+ hours.  I've got games that I "liked" which did not have as much replay value and I don't have over 60 hours logged playing them.  The only game I have logged this much time on is the original Thea the Awakening, and the Elder Scrolls Skyrim.  For anyone looking for a game that is worth the money for the long term entertainment value, it's this one.  I can't wait to see more from this developer.  The only thing I can think of that might add more content would be the ability to expand your settlement onto multiple hexes like the Civilization franchise did with districts.  You could have entire village encounter tables based around whether you had built the trading district much like the trading encounter you get in the current game once you've built the trading post building.  Just dreaming...

author: {'steamid': '76561198067663198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1581613137}
review:
The game is very mediocre and I was bored after just a few hours.

What turned me away the most was the unimaginative tech tree: Gather resource X to build thing Y. Then do some research to gather resource X+ to build thing Y+. But X+ and Y+ are gameplay wise just the same thing with a different name. There's no additional strategic elements opened up through the tech tree. There are no synergies between different steps in the tech tree. The "upgraded" variants are just the same things with different colors. Nothing to explore here.

Also the combat feels bothersome and disconnected from the rest of the game.

And it takes 20 turns, 10 clicks and 7 different screens to build and equip a new weapon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032342348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2655, 'last_played': 1605337247}
review:
It makes me quite sad as a huge fan of Thea 1, but some aspects of this game are so clumsy that I just can not recommand it.

1. I find the child system absolutely horrendous. Most of the events that can trigger childs only happen if you have a low number of children. Many of them are 1-time events that wont come back again. So, the only reliable way to get children is to buy them in villages, and have to wait hundreds of turns to buy more of them... In fact, I found it so bad that I recoded it in the event editor...

2. I dont like the material system either. High tier materials can't be found on the map and have to be cooked. Because of this:
* Getting high tier materials is an horribly long process. You have to spend a lot of research points to unlock them, and a huge quantity of 'findable' tier 3 materials.
* In addition, I believe it lowers the replayability of the game: every run looks the same, I wander in the land until I find a spot with at least 2 different tier 3 materials and coal, build my village and grind to death until I have powerful weapons and can start exploring the world again.

3. Speaking of replayability: there are just not enough different events, at least in the early game. Every game, you get the same 1-time events (beginner's quest, divine quest, kurv game, goldfish). Then, you continuously spam the same few repetable events (demon with a tooth problem and its ramifications)

4. The game has performance issues. The longer the game has been running, the slower it gets. My PC is not a war machine,but I can still play all the other games I have rather smoothly, including Thea 1.

That beeing said, I will continue to spend some time on this game and the editor (which is awesome), until I find a way to make it feel more balanced, replayable and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224638656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1684896651}
review:
[h1] Very Fun and Challenging Game! [/h1]
This game is very fun, and does take some getting used to play. It is a rogue, lite or like doesn't matter, and it can get very hard and unforgiving, especially the later the game goes on. Also, don't entirely expect to have the game walk you through how to play it, since it can be a bit confusing at parts. Mainly just read what all descriptors say and just mess around with the features to see what works. 

[h1] There is Multiplayer in This Game! But it's Buggy as Hell [/h1]
I really enjoy the multiplayer, when it works. Unfortunately, my friend and I typically lose a game from a game breaking bug that pulls up an event that's non-existent and you can't leave, causing the whole save file beyond it to become corrupt. Also if you go to previous save files of the same game (like if you messed up and want to go back), that will also potentially break your multiplayer game. It's unsure if this is bug only happens with my copy or if others have experienced it, but I might as well warn others about it. 
In all honesty, try the multiplayer with a friend or 3 and see how far you guys get without the game breaking. I've found it most enjoyable with just me and another person, but a larger group could possibly like it. I've also never really touched single player, since I usually just play with my friend. We did the same in the first Thea as well. The main difference is that you can sometimes invite your friends to events and share benefits like experience and research points. Item and blessing benefits can sometimes only give to the host or select random people within both parties. But, it can be easily traded if someone truly wants it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061145575', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11426, 'last_played': 1699580935}
review: I love this game! As a big fan of Thea 1, this game came with all of the improvements I wanted from the previous title. You have more choice over your unit's development while also retaining the individuality of your units. You assist their development instead of controlling it. The gameplay is different, but in a refreshing way. The challenges were streamlined, so instead of 9 different challenge types, there are 3 instead. The newer combat types allow you to be more adventurous with splitting your group. Other QOL changes include crafting outside your base, decided where your base is instead of restarting, know when children will grow up (via "age up" timer) & deciding their growth, being able to form multiple bases, or being completely nomadic. I find this to be a great sequel that also stands on it's own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017054401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 2820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2820, 'last_played': 1594935402}
review:
I like a lot of things about THEA 2, however, the question i ask myself is: Is it better than THEA - The Awakening? And unfortunately the answer is no. I feel like all the good things are recycled from the first game and that the new battle system is kind of naff. I suppose the battle system in the first game wasn't amazing and ultimately it probably wasn't amazingly strategic or varied. Alas, THEA 2's system is boring and adds nothing for me. That said, I think if the devs are trying something new then that's not a bad thing, it just doesn't hold up for me. So, when I want to play a THEA game again it will be The Awakening not The Shattering.
I would say If you like the first game then you'll probably like the second but if you have not played The Awakening then you should try it before this one.
I'll thumb it up because of the good writing, how unique the franchise feels and the quality of the full package over all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006917383', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1603275587}
review:
I want a short review because words are scary!: Buy Thea 1. Thea 2 offers nothing new and is actively worse in a big way.

Long review:
Not a good game, purely for one reason. The grindfest in this is the worst I think I've ever seen. I genuinely cannot fathom why the developers actually added such a tedious, punishing method to obtain resources into the game, especially because they actually replaced a much better, much quicker, much more convenient method!

There are tiers of resources, the more common they are, the less amazing they are. Makes sense, right? same as pretty much any other game that has even a vague civ type aspect. You can turn lesser resources into better ones. Sounds good so far, right? well, once it was. You could turn straight up make x amount of thing. Then it was changed. Queue the saltiness. Now you need to make at best 2 of item x per turn, which sounds awful when I point out that you need sometimes upwards of 90 resources to make something like a building. That's 45 turns of clicking the NEXT TURN button. But wait! You need to make the stuff to make the stuff to make the stuff you actually need! They added up to three extra steps to a process which is a big no-no in gaming. You make things more streamlined when it involves resources. What this means is that suddenly the 45 turns you need to click NEXT TURN stretch into potentially hundreds of turns. 

As an example, lets say you want to make a school (because that's what I'm destroying my soul trying to do right now). I want it to be the best it can be, which looks like 60 pure stone and 30 secret alloy. My village is on a source of granite and I have coal nearby, which is good because I can turn 1 of each into 4 sandstone. Eight sandstone can be turned into 2 clay. 12 clay can be turned into 2 obsidian and 12 obsidian can be turned into 2 pure stone. I'm not going to do the math to see how long it will take or how many resources I need, because frankly I suspect the end result would straight up make me vomit. And that's without working out how much time and effort I need to make the secret alloy as well.

Something else that may or may not annoy the hell out of you is that they've straight up ported a mass of the events from the first game into this one. You are meant to be battling some sort of 'light' but you continually get events referring to the badness from the previous game as though you were fighting that instead. Like they couldn't even be bothered to do a find and replace.

A third annoying thing is how few characters you can recruit. In Thea 1 at around turn 300 I had over a hundred people. And by people I mean orcs, elves, goblins, wolves, dwarves, demons, ghosts, some sort of shadow monster lady, Baba Yaga (twice!), giant spiders, an actual giant... in this I have 17.

I cannot wrap my head around why they would take such an amazing and tragically underrated game as Thea 1 and then make this. 



Edit: Back again, to add more complaining about another utterly bafflingly stupid part of the game. You can make friends with different factions, right? get rep points for doing good stuff, faction likes you more. Problem is, there are events that will give you faction rep penalties without giving you any warning why! If there were clues hidden in the text, like maaaaaybe it mentions the ruin looks dwarven then you could go 'aha! Better not knock any walls done for stone, the dwarves hate that!' and feel smug. But every graveyard is described as being human. 

What's worse, is that the other factions will attack you. Almost constantly. No matter what rep you have with them.BFF with those guys in the next village? they throw a party when you visit? well, screw you, time to fight a patrol and loose rep if you win. No way to avoid it. Great game design there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271337900', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1605847668}
review:
Прошел игру стоя на месте и прокликивая ходы. 
Мэйнквест спаунится почти под ногами. 
Эксплоринг и острова/биомы есть, но не нужны, лучше стой и прокликивай ходы.
Насколько же разраб поленился даже спаун мейн квеста в соседний биом поставить, чтобы у тебя был хоть какой-то смысл исследовать мир.
Не можешь пройти квест или энкаунтер? Стой, подожди, ты прокликал недостаточно ходов. 
Нужно оружие и доспехи? Прокликай ходы. 
Если прокликать достаточно ходов можно закончить игру с оружием из камня первого уровня. 
Сказочное чтиво, которое через 10 часов игры ты прокликиваешь с закрытыми глазами.
Симулятор нажимания песочных часиков из цивилизации.
Первое знакомство конечно крутое, но вскоре ты понимаешь как все на самом деле работает,  и ничего кроме разочарования не ощущаешь.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038424499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 18375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12157, 'last_played': 1706009322}
review: Like Thea: the Awakening, but subtly different and better. The short answer is:A turn based mystical story role playing game with gathering, crafting and resource management.  If you like micromanaging your party, like tactical/strategic thinking, a rich mystical story background but aren't concerned with flashy graphics then this game is thoroughly recommended.A short overview:If you've played the previous Thea game, this game will be both familiar and also unfamiliar.  A quick rundown; the objective of the game is to survive and do quests with an initially small group of followers who you can move about a map, tell them to gather, craft or attack/interact with other people or places.  You can split groups (maybe you want two people to wander off) and eventually you might want to found a village so you can have a base to return to.  You also get to craft some buildings in your village that will help you make things, gather things or learn things faster etc.  Along the way you will have random encounters, random monsters and be given quests you can decide to do or not.  You will explore the island you are on and if you get a boat you will be able to travel to other islands nearby.  You might have people join, or have children, but these are usually random and/or based on encounters or quests.  There is a lot of strategy involved in what you do, how you explore, what items you craft and who you want to make up your team and how they level up.A longer in depth overview:You start the game choosing a god, then choosing who will be in the party and what items they may have.  None of that is intuitive so it's worth while reading the manual or watching a tutorial or a lets play video.  Depending on your settings you will get a tutorial and initial instruction on how to play and craft food/items and then it goes on from there.  There is no separate tutorial, it's all built into the same game.  If you really want to you can ignore the tutorial objectives and do your own thing.The majority of the game is made up of equipping items, deciding what to do in camp/village with your people (eg what to gather and draft etc), and then there are the encounters, which come in three different types (Melee, wisdom/talking and mystical/magical).  Fighting these encounters happens on a board where you and the enemy take turns to play ability cards based upon the abilities and weapons your group has.  For instance in a a melee combat you might choose your fighter character to use their axe, but then later they might spawn a pet boar on the board more as a meat shield rather than to do damage.  You then resolve the combat which occurs over 2 rounds, with the cards taking turns to do their attacks onto the other cards.  Damage is assigned as the battle occurs, and if a character takes more damage than their hit points, then their cards disappear from the board and they won't get to use those abilities.  Most of resolution of the combat is automatic, but you might get to chose who your characters attack if they have a ranged ability for instance.  There is a lot of strategic thinking required here, as abilities have a time element to them, so you might play a lower power attack simply because it's more likely to hit quicker, or you might play an ability that delays the opponents attack and power etc.  Equipping different armour and items makes a big difference here, as does the makeup of your team as you have limited number of cards you can have to play in each battle.  Destroy the all the hit points of your opponent and you win the battle and the encounter.There will be a degree of randomness (RNG) about the monsters you face or when for instance you get to level up characters from a child to adult. You might find this annoying as you really want o build the best item or get a specific type of person/specialist and the RNG doesn't fall into your favour.  However you can manipulate the odds by building or crafting things.  For instance if you want to get a witch or Zerca you might build a playground that boasts the stats for mysticism.  There is a lot of micromanaging later on in the game as you get better and better things.  Characters come in many different types, from humans, elves, orcs, demons or animals.  You can then get specialists, for instance gatherers, witches and warriors.  There will also be some subtypes such as bandits that have slightly different characteristics.  All characters have a base set of stats that then are used to calculate their abilities.  For instance you might have one character that has a strength of 5 and one that has a strength of 2.  The number of physical hit points will be higher for the one with 5, as will the melee damage they can do.  You can manipulate these stats depending on the gear you give them, boosting gathering, mysticism etc.  So even the one with strength of 2 could hit harder than the one with 5 if they were given a particularly powerful item.  Initially you will need to think carefully how you unlock the skills tree and also think carefully how you want to tech up your characters.  Levelling the characters takes time, and you will be given an option of either three stats or 2 abilities.  Usually the stats come in the flavour of one going up by 2 and the others by 1 only.  For instance you might want to have one character very physically strong, but to do that you might pass up opportunities to improve their wisdom or mysticism.Eventually you will be able to travel to the different islands, where you will find harder foes, different quests and different resources to gather.  Ironically you often need the better resources on these islands to create better equipment to face these encounters.  Returning to the game subsequent times you can manipulate the difficulty depending on your starting settings and which gods you choose.  When you first play you will only have a limited number of options, but when you complete the game you will unlock more, so the game encourages you to return.  Personally I love this kind of game, and I also feel good about the fact they are small indie developer.  The DLC's are free and if you want to give them something back you can with the Pizza DLC, which you can buy any number of times, and unlocks a few behind the scenes things but nothing to affect the game directly.  I've not played the multiplayer game in either this or the previous Thea to comment so can't really comment on how the mechanics work for that.  I will likely be playing this game for years to come and envisage returning to complete each god!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006975953', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1646239770}
review:
Z jednej strony druga cześć jest porządnie rozbudowana względem poprzedniczki jednak z drugiej straciła coś co przyciągało i bawiło w pierwowzorze. Więcej postaci, spotkań, zależności, sekretów, surowców i wiele innych możliwości co jest jak najbardziej na plus. 

Na minus tymczasem mamy podział na wyspy który zabrał dużo z pozytywów losowości gdzie blisko wioski mogliśmy mieć wysokiej jakości surowiec co dawało efekt "wow" :) Obecnie niestety grupy surowców na stałe przypisane są do wysp wokół startu gdzie również spotkamy silniejsze potwory. Dodatkowo najlepsze surowce możemy zdobyć jedynie przez rzemiosło co kończy się niesamowicie nieprzyjemnym i długim farmieniem. 

Również poziom trudności jest większy niż w poprzedniczce przez częste spotkania z potworami wymagającymi konkretnego podejścia na które nie jesteśmy gotowi w skutek czego możemy szybko zostać wybici(nawet na niskim poziomie trudności).

Podsumowując mimo iż Thea 2 oferuje więcej to jest niestety bardziej meczącą i żmudną częścią przez co daje dużo mniej frajdy niż pierwsza część. Niestety nie polecam.

review: Игра очень понравится тем, кто любит "пожанглировать" ресурсами, едой,  шмотками и оружием. Поначалу казалось, что ты в этом утонешь, но нет - микроменеджемент продуман очень хорошо. Если что-то не удобно, значит вы ещё не разобрались в интерфейсе. Прекрасная атмосфера и графика. Бои скорее тактические, нежели карточные. Море текстовых событий и приключений. Остаётся непонятным, почему игра на славянскую тему не имеет славянской локализации, хотя бы текстовой. Но английский язык в игре очень простой, без устаревших "заморочек".

author: {'steamid': '76561197972483399', 'num_games_owned': 1027, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 22578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1586, 'last_played': 1686621393}
review:
I'm forced to revise this review, which was first a SCATHING panning of this title which i've through stubborn struggle and love of the original I have arrived at a grudgingly favorable review rathar than my previous plea to play the original and spare oneself this sequel. 

Read any other negative reviews to get a good idea as to what the difficulty of entry to this game is and everything that was done different (in many ways too different) from the original. I will give it a more fair shake in my review, and explain why.

I wanted to see this sequel so badly come to light, and was devastated when I saw the finished product. A veteran of the first game I was nonetheless slaughtered and punished repeatedly and endlessly until I figured out some of the opaque things about the game that were so elegant and simple in the first one. 

Most people might not have the nerve or the courage to give the game the number of second chances I did... but ultimately it won me over. Here are my gripes and what I feel mitigated them:

Combat System: NOTHING mitgated this. Compared the the novel and elegant combat of the first game the new combat system is pretty, but is otherwise a overcomplicated convoluted and outwardly inscrutable mess. I Auto-Resolve 100% of my challenges in this game. I'm glad the option exists because without auto-resolution the game would be unplayable to me. 

The loot system: The loot system for the old game was simple but elusively deep and enjoyable for me -- and the sequel does not disappoint in this regard ONCE YOU UNDERSTAND WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON.  My first impressions of the look system were that it was vastly more complicated (and once understood it is in a good way but until you really struggle with it just appears to be a slap in the face of the previous game's simplicity. Now that i understand the loot system I really love it, but the first dozen games and HOURS of playtime I saw no other means to produce anything but complete crap... even with great materials. It's just not obvious until you do some expensive experimenting just how much better other "Tiers" of items can be when the indicators can be downright convoluted and even misleading. I still don't 100% know what's going on, but can at least tell what's better incrementally and how to avoid making everything I craft into a piece of crap. 

Materials for the game are worlds more varied and complex, and greater materials are found in the wild or are composites of lesser materials. I enjoy the crafting system now... but at first entry it was needlessly opaque and even stressful. 

The "Spine" of the game, the story, god mechanics, and gameplay once you get past the numerous barriers to understanding and enjoyment is truly a "one more turn" kind of game, and I found myself grudgingly loving the game despite hating it before when I finally got past the vicious and sometimes arbitrary difficulty of one starting out to the midgame where you actually have an idea of what you can face without getting smashed and the meaningfulness of some of your choices.

Things light "Lightbringers" being HARD to fight magically and much easier to fight conventionally do not make themselves obvious and were endlessly frustrating. Especially since if lightbringers attacked you, they get to pick Magic combat, just like you figure out later you can pick physical combat if you attack them first. But my first experiences with getting slaughtered by them made the idea of attacking first completely counter-intuitive to me. That's just one example of the way this game kicks you in the balls and laughs as you reload over and over. I seriously save scum the hell out of this game. Rewards are awful early game, and punishment is always more severe and permanent than advancement or success. I've been able to enjoy this game with a network of layered save files that assure something I did 10 turns ago (eg after it's autosaved) doesn't come back and blast your game to pieces. 

I've given the game enough of my Ire, I'm just glad I broke through to the part where I can express and enjoy the "love" part of the game. It really stands on the shoulders of the first game and really shows more depth and breadth and each individual revamp of a system is truly an improvement on the original. To veterans of the first game, all these changed in aggregate will make the game a confusing and semi-unrecognizable mess. 

But I wouldn't give up, and I'm really enjoying the game now, despite how ridiculously hard and punishing it can be. My best advice is simply not to give up, experiment, and there is gold to be found here.

Buyer beware, Fans of the first game you have been warned, and I hope you overcome like I did, unlike all the bad reviews the game got for the same reasons. It's worth it.

Grudgingly recommended.

Sadly they have ruined perfectly working good design. They have over complicated the great design of Thea-1 with lots of new variables. Strength of the old game was in its simplicity. it was a new concept and needed understanding at first but simple mechanics allowed easy and quick comprehension.

Sorry Devs, it is what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130394906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4601, 'last_played': 1595619209}
review:
Симулятор сидения на месте.
Боёвка своеобразная, претензий не имею.
Гуляешь по карте ищешь место с углём, жратвой и минимум 2-3 ресурсами 2 круга (мне фартануло и я нашёл 4) и сидишь...
Ооооочень долго сидишь на месте и крафтишь.
Вокруг куча заданий и руин, а ты сидишь и крафтишь, потому что если вытащишь из деревни хотя бы малую часть чувачков из деревни то их сожрут гуляющие вокруг гопники, а потом сожрут и деревню. Да и людей катастрофически не хватает чтобы так просто их распылить.
А потом ты такой выходишь из деревни 1-2 чуваками в стихийной экипировке и они уже в соло всех раскидывают.
Легендарную экипировку до максималки так и не поднял, может не доиграл до этого ещё, хотя вроде 700 ходов прошло...
Говорят можно запилить 2 деревню. Да вы о чём? Я 600 ходов крафтил всё что мог на 1 месте и даже начального квеста на посещение деревни славян не сделал.
Теперь у меня деревня из спартанцев и царя Леонида, топовые стаки с лешими идут на растопку, а дети гладят оборотней как корги. Но я по прежнему сижу и херачу топовую экипировку, потому что не смогу этого сделать группой выбежавшей из деревни, ведь там может появится новый человек и его надо будет одевать. Замкнутый круг, крафт ради крафта.
Игра интересна только системой квестов и фентезийной тематикой, ну и карточная боёвка неплоха, на любителя.
Но вот этот самый дикий крафт на сотни ходов на одном месте, это вымораживает.
Я даже в скайлайнс так долго город не созерцаю, обязательно что-то строю.
Но это просто ах...
Игра не плоха и даже очень, но тягомотина в крафте это очень сильный минус. И огромная карта которую нельзя заселить как в цивилизации, нахера она нужна? Ну да ладно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099958341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3950, 'last_played': 1588885982}
review: Kazimeira was a pretty child. She helped her family in the fields, in the kitchen, and even dabbled in some research, after 30 turns came her Rite of Passage... then Bam... 60 year old cauldron stirrer! Thea 2 is a game about how life in a fantasy apocalypse can rapidly age you - one minute you're a child, romping through the fields picking berries, next minute you're a ninety year old hag with a nose like Gérard Depardieu stooping over a medieval cooking vessel. It's not called "The Shattering" for nothing - I think it refers to the hopes and dreams of these poor children!
