author: {'steamid': '76561198135644423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3523, 'last_played': 1689872322}
review:
В данном обзоре я не буду учитывать огромное количество багов, недоработок и нефункционал некоторых опций, так как игра вышла в ранний доступ пару дней назад и это всё легко исправится (надеюсь), по этому обзор будет исключиельно положительным.
По сравнению с первой теей есть масса плюсов, по этому пишу именно под впечатлением, как игрок в первую чать игры:
1) Полностью переработанная система навыков и перков для персонажей. У каждого персонажа теперь 3 шкалы хит поитов: здоровье, благоразумие и вера. У каждой своя роль основной характеристики хп в разных испытаниях. При том интересно, что способы восстановления разные. Например очень сильно потрепавшись в испытании на смекалку ваши персонажи будут тратить мораль на восстановление благоразумия и могут не вступить в бой против врага, если будут слишком истощены, но эт этого они не умрут.
2) Полностью переработана боевая система. Куча новых способностей, таких как различные сплеши, призыв демонов и нежити, бафы и т.п. Автобой пока хромает, так что лучше биться вручную.
3) Крафт переделан и сделан намного удобнее. Вариаций теперь стало намного больше используя различные материалы, разные способы создания и т.п. Появилась функция "Дизайн", которая позволяет посмотреть все возможные комбинации и добавление рецептов в избранное. Появилось новое оружие, под тип свитков и реликвий, которыми пользуются маги (или дети)
4) Дети теперь не ресурс, а полноценный член отряда! Они так же кушают, дерутся с вами и могут умереть. Инициация теперь стала целым ритуалом, где вы можете выбрать ребёнку профессию или попытать счастье и превратить его в демона или гоблина. И дети бывают не только человеческие)
5) Деревню теперь можно ставить в любом месте и не обязательно делать это сразу. Это нужно, как по мне, только когда выш отряд уже перегружен и нужно куда-то складывать добро.
6) То что меня больше всего поразило - корабли. Теперь можно плавать между островами, причём играя за стрибога это делается очень быстро (7 ходов у меня было). А самое интересное, что даже случайные события в море есть!
В итоге: Тея 2 - это не повторение первой части, а полноценное продолжение с добавлением кучи новых функций, которые делают игру лучше и удобнее как в визуальном плане, так и в геймплейном. Всем любителям первой части - однозначно советую в неё поиграть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007557456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1671248473}
review:
Do not buy this in Early Access, especially if you played and enjoyed Thea 1.

If you played Thea: The Awakening, you know it's a gem filling a unique niche in the turn-based game market.  The art is lovely, the music is great, and the game has real character.  So you might - as I did - expect Thea 2 to improve upon that formula and present a really well-refined, enjoyable experience.

That is not what's happening in Early Access.  The UI is a horrible mess, with bad zoom/FoV, poor menus, and terrible failures to provide the player with helpful information.  The game itself is so heavily reliant on RNG that even once you've learned the mechanics (and if you played the first one, it won't take you any more than an hour to understand all the changes) you can't actually make a plan for your characters.  The new mechanic additions are not well polished at all.

There's a lot of potential, here, and given how many hours I put into the first one, I really hope they iron things out and offer up a game worthy of the name Thea.  But that's not what they've put up for Early Access.  Thea 1 underwent substantial changes from release to Return of the Giants.  Give MuHa some time to turn this into a good game.

Unless you simply want to support MuHa regardless of what they're selling, wait for release.  Do not buy this in EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798154927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1608101890}
review:
First Thea was great and this is more of that same goodness, many things were changed, some for the better, some very questionable. Like say the game looks even more gorgeous, great sound, polished tech tree but at the same time the buildings seem limited as it was during Thea 1 e.a. 
I like the fact that you can select where you'll build your village, that is 10/10. I also love the outstanding quality of art, but what i dont enjoy is how confusing the 'rewards' for things are. Your dudes gained 2 of "unknown icon". I look up stats nothing looks anything close to the other icon i just saw. Sure sometimes its what you can understand like gathering or wisdom but what is that red icon with hands in the air? Raw hp? Needs like a little explanation or something.

Also not really a fan of the new combat system, while i do like that its fresh, the options seem more limited and its a bit more confusing tbh. Maybe its just because i havent played it much, but there really did seem like there were more combat options in 1st one. 

Regardless this is definitely a 'buy and enjoy this' recommendation. Once again, great job devs! Keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030271396', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 5373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1565542378}
review:
En dehors des bugs et plantages, certes génants mais attendus en early acces, on peut emettre des critiques à mon sens plus graves quant au gameplay  : 

- le jeu est un copier-coller du premier opus, sans originalité ou grande nouveauté. On serait même dans la régression fâce au premier opus, et l'early access ne l'excuse pas.
- le système de combat par cartes est incompréhensible, on ne sait pas ce qu'on fait, qui on affronte, donc difficile d'établir la moindre stratégie
- trop peu de tooltip pour obtenir une information, même succinte, sur les icones représentant... ben on ne sait pas ce que cela représente.
- le dosage de la difficulté a été modifié, on ne peut que s'en féliciter. Cependant, on se retrouve trop souvent à enchainer des events sans queue ni tête qu'on résout peu ou prou toujours de la même façon.
- les ressources les plus intéressantes sont sur des iles éloignées de la votre, perdues dans le brouillard de guerre. Alors, oui, les rechercher, c'est de l'exploration... Mais que c'est long et peu gratifiant.

Théa premier du genre m'avait réellement enthouasiasmé par son originalité. En l'état, Théa 2 ne mérite pas le détour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042657329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2094, 'last_played': 1606428427}
review:
If you liked the first Thea you'll probably like this one too. The character attributes have gotten a welcome simplification. Thea 1 had 23 atttributes, some of which affected each other, that decided the strength of 8 different actions in 9 different challenge-type. Thea 2 has 6 primary attributes grouped in 3 pairs, where each pair affects actions in just one challenge-type (physical, mental and spiritual) So it is much, much simpler to see which character will be good at what type of challenge. You also get three choices for attribute/skill-upgrade on level up, so you can actually shape each character towards a specific role. You also start out without a village and can build one when you find a suitable location. The combat/challenge cardgame has been completely changed. It has become a lot more conventional card-rpg style system, where you lay out cards in two rows (melee-row and ranged-row) versus the enemy's two rows and different skills/weapons will hit different cells (i.e. a sword hits the melee-cell in the same column, a spear hits both melee- and ranged-cell in the samme column etc.) I think I preferred the system in Thea I as it was so much more unpredictable. As in a single move by the enemy might change the outcome completely, making it a lot more exciting. But I haven't tried this out enough yet to judge it fairly.

But some important features are missing in the early access version. Most notably, there aren't any difficulity/gameplay settings. Also, the combat/challenge animations are very slow and can't be adjusted, which is testing my patience big time. The last update fixed this somewhat with a setting that doubles the speed of animations, but you have to toggle it in every battle. You can auto-finish combat, but it seems to cause really bad outcomes: I would say on par with just randomly putting out cards. So if you like to tweak the settings to get a tailored challenge and/or are impatient like me I would hold of until those things are in place.

Update: Sadly, there is still a lot of serious bugs that needs fixing. Quest-markers and resource-locations will sometimes disapear. Sometimes all characters joins challenges you only approach with some of your characters. Penalty for not having fuel when camping doesn't work. Characters assigned to crafting will automatically be re-assigned to gathering. So my verdict is that this game isn't ready for playing now, unless you want to help out reporting bugs.

Update 26.jan:
It seems the bug-situation has improved a lot. I've played for 100 turns now and the only issue I have encountered is that the group-encumberance penalty doesn't seem to kick in when it should. It's seems to start giving a penalty at about 150% of max weight, but the penalty doesn't seem to be quite consistent. Difficulty-settings have been implemented (especially appreciate the realism-setting which allows max one gathering/turn from each resource). In the start I found the card-challenges to be too easy, but once I travelled to other islands things got a lot more interesting. There still aren't any quest-log or minimap. The first would be very welcome since it often feels kind of aimless when there's no narrative for lots of turns and you feel a bit unsure if there is something that you were supposed to do to progress the storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011744989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1707580298}
review:
And the devs delivered! 

Build 0278 - 13th Dec
- Fixed the problem with multiplayer saves not loading correctly (ie. players being positioned on water)
- Fixed buttons for version difference in multiplayer lobby crashing game



I specifcally bought this game to play multiplayer with my girlfriend. We enjoyed the original Thea and this looks like a polished & updated sequel with new events and features. I wasn't expecting nor did I want an entirely new gameplay experience (like some of the review I've seen). It mostly delivers.


What I expect from an early access title are barebones features and bugs scattered around that necessitate a reload from time to time. I also am fully expecting that my saves will be wiped whenever there is an update. The features are mostly fleshed out and far beyond what most early access titles offer. The bugs are there and plenty from graphical errors to failing to load into combat. All this needing a save and restart maybe every 20-30 turns so far. This is all fine to me as I signed up to an early access.

The main weakness in the current game is the lack of advancement points (science points as everyone knows them). Now the devs have said that they are going to add an advancement system in later. But currently the only ways to advance are at a snails pace with a building that takes a while to get to or by completing quests. Not combat encounters but only quests of which you have no quest tracker and don't know the difficulty going in. What this can mean is that the lesss min/max player can choose 'incorrect' unlock path and not have the necessary equipment or resources in order to beat these encounters. 



With all this said I'm going to give this a tentative recommendation. The devs are firing out more updates than Windows 10 when you're in the middle of something and the game is fairly polished for an early access. 



----------

PREVIOUS PARAGRAPH FOR CONTEXT: THIS IS NO LONGER TRUE


"Where the game gets its 'not recommended' from me is that I am unable to load a multiplayer save. Every single multiplayer save, be it autosave or manual, is corrupted and gives a wall of red text and errors on load. Obviously this makes the simple reload bugs gamebreaking. I've only manged 20-30 mintues at a time in any multiplayer game before I have to save/reload which means that that playthrough is over."

author: {'steamid': '76561198131910456', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1689184191}
review: I was quite disappointed with this game. It seems the developers took the first game and repeated the main gameplay elements, the story board, map movement and crafting mechanics. But the character of the game is not there anymore, it is just recycled content. I found it in the crafting screen for example they have made a terrible decision adding something called 'design mode' where you can combine resources that you still haven't acquired to see all the high end weapons that you can make. So compared to the first game this takes away the excitement and hard work of obtaining new resources because you already know what you'll get! When I say they removed the character of the game I mean for example the weapons in Thea 1 had interesting names like Leshy's Wrath and Svarr's Grace. In this game they are called 'Dragon sword' and 'Shadow sword' and so on. And you can see that the graphics are not like artwork anymore, they are more like simple variations, the dragon sword has a different colour than the bone sword kind of thing. I found the complexity really defeats this game in a number of ways. The combat mechanics are different from Thea 1 but really worse, because each combat takes much longer and while seems more complicated the end results seem to matter a lot less based on strategy, so one more or less get the same result no matter where one places people and what techniques one used. Compared to Thea 1 the combat was like a clever puzzle and the decisions one made really affected the outcome. In this game because the combat takes so long one would need a really long commitment to get anywhere in this game because the game is based on a LOT of combat. Also the resource and crafting screens are much more complex in this game but it really isn't an improvement, it's like they thought would be good enough to have a new game just add some resources and tech trees. My overall impression is that there is a lot of complexity added in many places, such as new resources, new weapon types, ability to have several villages, new combat and many new stat-types. But these new things haven't been able to make the game more interesting, the new complexity didn't improve the game it just more tedious to get through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068803494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 7853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1675797098}
review:
希亚：嘴炮觉醒 的续作
一代的游戏是非常值得推荐的，二代的话目前还是早期测试，有很多（非常多）的地方还不完善乃至缺少功能，事件很容易重复，鼠标悬停之后很多时候不像一代那样会很方便地显示详细信息，很多时候你完全不知道那些图标是什么意思，优化很差，间接导致战斗很慢，快进又不是像一代那样真正的快进，而是直接跳过了，前期选择很少，一代的时候你的选择会丰富很多，神明系统不完善而且也看不到怎么解锁新的神（可能还没做好？），不过我相信这些到后面会慢慢改进，对制作团队比较放心。
我想说不建议现在购买，因为真的不完善，如果没有玩过一代的话可以先去把一代买来玩玩，不过话说回来最后反正都是要买的，所以你现在买以后买其实也没差。。。

————————————————————

更新一下评测，不得不说官方更新的速度很快，优化的问题已经通过添加画质选项得到了极大的改善，然后可选神的话，我才发现原来这个游戏从一代开始可选神就是创建游戏用户的时候直接给你随机的两个，只要不停地创建新用户就可以把没有特殊解锁条件的神全部随机出来看一遍，不过不得不说这一代的神不如一代设定那么丰富，游戏性上体现得不是特别好，太同质化了（虽然一代也有一点，但是升级之后区别是很大的，不过估计以后还要更新特性的）。
然后这一代的小孩儿是可以工作和战斗的，但是一般来说战斗的时候小孩儿就是吃瓜看戏，主要还是工作用，小孩儿长大除了可以选择目前你村庄提供的升级选项之外，还可以随机，这个随机其实就和开箱子一样，甚至有可能直接把你的小孩儿变成恶魔之类的东西，我就随机出了一个风暴恶魔。。。
游戏的事件目前感觉不是很多，很容易重复，一代的时候基本上你一整局除了固定会出现的任务之外其他的事件可以做到整场不重复，不过早期测试可以理解。
游戏的美工真是好，一代的美工就很不错而且很有特点，二代主要是走的是唯美路线，也很棒。
游戏的UI优化目前我只能说很差，倒退的时候不是全部都能按esc，有的地方必须用鼠标去点返回或者取消，然后还是和上面说的一样，很多详细信息你看不到，或者很难查看到，很多东西你必须点到不同的页面里才能看到详细信息，比如你在分配食物和木头的时候看不到数量，非要翻到物品栏才能看到详细数目，就很烦，诸如此类的界面设置还有制作界面，一代的时候这些界面不需要大面积切换，都是小窗口完成的，所以就方便很多，二代这里就稍微有点麻烦了，还有人物的装备界面，不过总体无伤大雅，只是不知道后期这样切换来切换去会不会比一代还要烦。。。还有很多的项目栏没有完成，不过早期测试这些都可以理解，也相信会很快更新。
个人当然是推荐这个游戏的啦，绝对可以放心购买，还是那句话，不想玩儿测试的可以先去玩儿一代。

————————————————————

官方更新真是太勤快了，今天终于能够显示图标的详细信息了，非常棒~
然后就是，我发现这个游戏里居然可以跨物种杂交。。。一开始先是我的一个小孩儿长大了，我选了随机，随机成了哥布林，然后过了段事件我村子里的另一个女孩儿长大了，接着没过多久这两人出了个事件，得到了一个哥布林孩子。。。

————————————————————

又更新了，我觉得这次更新应该是改了事件的概率，因为。。。以前是不停地出恶性事件死小孩儿，现在是不停地出事件生小孩儿，小孩儿的数量有点失控了。。。人多到我可以把他们当成消耗品来使用。。。不过其实也没那么夸张，但是事件确实友好了很多，不会遇到那种前期一大堆强力事件导致GG的情况了。。。
优化进一步改善，基本上已经达到一代的优化水平了，但是操作优化还有很大的改进空间。
制作团队很不错~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198085592529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1691358319}
review:
I have to update my review from 2018. I stopped playing back then cuz the game just was not fun enough. 
I've decided to play it again yesterday. And the result... Let's just say I went to bed a lot later than I was going to.

I want to mention that the developers of this game impressed me. Usually when a game comes out unfinished, the devs never finish it properly. Well, this one is nothing like what it was on the beta release date. It's super fun now. Now it feels like an actual upgrade of the original Thea. I've only played for a few hours yesterday, but it felt a lot better balanced, filled with events. 

Events from thea 1 was an interesting solution, but it would be cool to see more unique events. Maybe as a part of a DLC.

//The old review:

The game is nowhere near finished. 

- Very few events
- Multiple bugs (such that F8 bugs out too)
- Some battles resolve automatically even though you don't click the automatic CTA
- Immense amount of missing tooltips
- Very few buildings
- No voiceovers (hell I enjoyed them a lot)
- A lot of funcrionality is missing. Like zooming/minimap/etc.

I'm saying all this not as a criticism. I know the devs are very well aware of all these issues and are working on them. I'm saying it so that the others would know what they're doing when buying the game.

I suggest people first play the first part to get a gist of how amazing the game is. 

Still giving the game thumbs up although I did expect it to be less raw than it is currently. 

I also feel like the game lacks marketing a lot. Nobody of my friends knows about the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024080920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1543634951}
review:
First game is excellent.  Still play it.

This one feels more like a poor remake than a sequel.

It's currently in an early, early Early Access stage.  Very rough.  The graphics and interface are clunky and unintuitive.
Feels like the developers threw out everything that worked well in the first game and started over as if having no experience at all.

Yes, Early Access games are in an unfinished state.  Yes bugs, yes they have place holder graphics.  But even taking all that into account the game feels empty and uninspired.  Some vital spark is missing.

Would only recommend buying at this point if you believe in the developer and want to support their efforts. Otherwise, wait a few months and see how the game develops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018193619', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 16567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6726, 'last_played': 1663029756}
review:
初代から面白い内容を沢山増やしたにも関わらず、余計な要素や制約等を加えたためにやりこむ価値が薄くなった残念な作品となってしまった。

■村は2つまでしか入手出来ない素材を使い、自分で好きな場所へ建てることが出来る
しかし最初の島は算出資源が低ランクなものしか無く、更には難易度によって余計に価値をなくしてしまう。
よって"好きな場所に建てていいけど最初の島は後々役立たずになるからね"という結果になる。
このバランスに対する回答は「非効率な村でも勝てるから大丈夫です」。

■6種の素材に5つのTierが存在しており、石炭を用いて高ランクへとアップグレードが出来る
しかし石炭は難易度によって初期の島に算出の可否を選ぶので、不要なものを再利用する事は難しい。
このバランスに対する回答は「初期の島で高ランクの素材を作らなくても勝てるから大丈夫です」。

■素材に応じて作りやすい武具や施設が変わるのでプレイスタイルが
変わらない。打撃や射撃の武器は単純な単体や範囲攻撃、上位になればエンチャント的な効果がつくとシンプル。
だがCodexだけは別で、これ一つで近距離遠距離攻撃、知識を物理攻撃に変換しディレイまで付与、召喚、バフデバフ、全体攻撃と優遇されている。
[strike]防具に関しても盾やアクセサリーはともかく、鎧は3種類あるにも関わらずヘビーアーマーだけが優遇されており他の選択が無い。[/strike]
アーマーは大幅にバフされておりローブでもある程度の防御力が期待出来る程になっていた。
武器に関する質疑は誰にも無かったようだ。

■子供の扱いがキャラクターへとなり成長もしてくれる。そして能力次第で色々な選択肢が増える
確かに能力値が足りなければ選択が発生しないが、むしろ問題はその選択肢の大半に"確率"が存在する。
たとえ条件を満たしていようが、どれだけ優れたステータスであろうがどれだけ頑張って施設を整備しようが、1d100で負ければ凡人クラスに格下げ最悪ロストである。
今作はヒューマン・ゴブリン・オーク・ドワーフ・エルフの子供が授かれるのだが、ドワーフとエルフはギャザクラ以外の選択肢が2～3割。酷いところでは5%クラスまで存在する。ソシャゲのSSRもびっくりである。
このバランスに関する回答は「レアなキャラは居なくても勝てるから大丈夫です」。

とまあかなり厳しい評価をしたけど、面白い点もちゃんとある
・カードでの戦闘は最初こそ苦労するが慣れると自動戦闘よりよい結果を出しやすい。
・無理に難易度を高くしなければセーブロードで吟味したり、初期の島も石炭を産出して陳腐化せずに使える
・海が渡れるのはやはり嬉しい。離島への探検は4Xでの魅力の一つだとおもう
・ごく一部のキャラは転生したりして強力な性能になる。ただしトレイラーのようなネズミがウェアウルフになるなんてのは極めて稀な内容なので騙されないように。
・ちゃんと定石さえ守れば勝てるゲームなのは確か。

評価としては勝利へのバランスを追求しすぎたせいでゲーム中の楽しめる要素を全否定してしまったという印象。
ランダム生成ゲームにも関わらずリプレイ性が低くなってしまった残念な作品である。
ただどのコンテンツもバランスをまともに把握している人がテコ入れすると良作に化けると思われる。なのでMODが推奨される作品ではないだろうか　といったところである。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999087872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1620880845}
review:
As it stands, I can see Thea 2 becoming an awesome game with enough different or new mechanics paired with enough familiarity to make it a worthy sequel, and I can’t wait to see what it becomes.  That being said, it is very much in EA.  Tooltips are missing, the resource tiles don’t light up when you research them, and most annoying to me: you can’t hover over an item’s sheet to see what all the numbers mean yet.  Currently, I can’t really tell what each skill for my characters even mean, let alone what they are without some serious guess work.

Now I trust the devs will correct all this before Thea 2 leaves EA, but until it does, I would suggest leaving Thea 2 alone for the time being.  I know I don’t want to burn out on an unfinished game, so I’m saving myself for now.  Since I can see a great game in the making, I still have to give Thea 2 a thumbs up, and I can say the money spent buying Thea 2 is a worthy investment for further down the road.

I have count the days for the release for a week now.

The game is the pleasure to explore for now (3 hours), I played the first Thea a week ago and in general this new game is a big improvement in so many ways ...
Combat system change a lot (I love the first one and I'm pretty sure I'm gonna love this one too), it's hard to master but it's not unfair and I truly feel like it is possible to kill strong ennemis with a good strategy.

Just a little warning, the beginning is harsh (you should be expecting more than a run to doing well) but you know ... falling to rise higher.

And remember it's an early access, the game is fully playable but not all functionnalities are there (I haven't seen any bugs so far).

So in my eye, MuHa have done a wonderful job and deserve all my thankfulness

author: {'steamid': '76561197993698924', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1647526709}
review:
First impressions (I might change this when I've played more).

Obvious comparision is the original Thea: The awakening, it plays very similarly.

Major changes: 
Characters got simplified a lot. Instead of having about fourty characteristics which were randomly used in various kinds of combat, they now have about ten. In all honesty, I had no idea which skill was good for what, but after the streamlinig, the characters seem very similar to each other. In the original, nonwarrior characters were almost guaranteed to be useful in nonphysical combat. Here... I didn't yet figure how to win nonphysical combat, because everyone seem to be weak.

Combat itself was revamped a lot. Seems more complicated, doesn't really feel more complex. And it's slooooow. Everything takes ages, which makes me use autoresolve as much as possible. Watching animations (or more like an animation of a firebolt-like effect) over and over again just isn't fun. They need to be skipable.

Crafting was fun in original Thea, because one just wanted to try different combinations to see what falls out. Here it seems to have been streamlined a bit and at the moment, I find it rather obscure. Most items end up with very similar stats. Also items are now much more resource hungry. Coupled with no rewards for killing random mobs and no monster lairs to raid, I'm not crafting much, because camping and scooping resources by endless pressing of end turn just isn't fun.

Village is now optional, player starts as a wandering group with the ability to "craft" a village. The group is small, i.e. not very splittable. The village is expensive and not very useful. I've created a village because... I always had a village in previous game, right? Then I started wondering why did I do it. Maybe it becomes more useful later in the game, but so far... not very.

UI was reworked, made more modern and became less understandable for me. It tries to show most information directly on mouseover, but there's no option to see details, so I often end up wondering why is something behaving the way it does or what exactly do the icons I see mean... but no deal.

It may sound like I don't like the game at all, but I actually do. I just feel like a lot of things are so far poorly balanced and unpolished. I feel strong urge to play the original, but I'm going to at least explore this one much more thoroughl. I'm giving conditional recommendation, because I believe most of the issues would eventually be adressed. I hope so anyway, because original thea was an awesome game and I'm really hoping for just as awesome sequel :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198094500314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 23930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1711896064}
review:
I was really excited about this release, guess what, I'm not disapointed at all.
Since it is in EA stage, I won't say it is fully playable since my game crashed after 70 turns, I couldn't start or cancel an encounter.
I will compare it to Thea The Awakening :
PROS:
- Way more complex : A lot of research, probably around 5 times more
- RPG like character lvl up (chose skills)
- Really interesting challenge, new mecanics
- Still as good as the first regarding the story line
- Contains an historegg (Theodore, is that you ?)
CONS:
- Moving group now takes 2 clics (it is frustrating)
- No narrative on the encounters (yet?)
- Auto-resolve is braindead (I am sure I did bad most of the time, but the auto resolve was always worst than me)
- Mouse over on buff / debuff gained after battle display character info, so you don't know what you got (really annoying)
- The new interface is not as clear as the previous one, and some actions requires more clics
- Game is not finished (Thanks captain!)

So I'm pretty sure this awesome team will manage to fix the few cons I've listed (or I'll get use to it), and what they are already showing us is definitly better than the previous (and I consider it in my favorite games), I can't wait for a final release.
And don't forget to buy if you are still hesistating, that team deserves support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030804524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1564450103}
review:
I want to start off by saying I played Thea: The Awakening and very much enjoyed it. I was very excited to see a sequel being released, and purchased it immediately on EA release. 

So far, I've played for about 2 hours, and the experience is very similar to the first game, but with improvements. You have more customization/control over your individual followers, you can choose settlement location(s!), and the outcomes of auto-resolving scenarios are more transparent. I am impressed with the additional features and am excited to see the game improve over the duration of EA.

With that being said, this game was just released. It is very EA. During the two hours I've spent playing I had to restart twice due to the game becoming very laggy and unresponsive and any attempt to reload an autosave caused the game to freeze. Given the quality of the previous game and the actively involved devs, I am confident that bugs will be worked out efficiently. 

As far as gameplay outside of EA issues, I am a little disappointed that the narrator is gone. That guy was great. (Maybe they're still working on the voice acting and haven't added it yet!)

If you liked Thea: The Awakening, this game seems like it will definitely be an even better version of the original. I still recommend the purchase. If you're impatient or can't handle EA issues, I would recommend waiting a little while before purchasing.

EDIT: 
I backed this game the day it went on kickstarter because i was so impressed with the developers on the first game.
I'm so so sad to say that it still feels as incomplete as it did when it launched in EA and some horrible design decisions have been made (the islands biomes are just dumb, different crafting mats don't matter as much as they did in Thea 1, everything is a chore now.) I would go into a long review but right now, on release day, I'm just a mix of sad and angry. Read the top negative review, it sums it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007301777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1583022469}
review:
Апдейт обзора после раннего доступа, после Морского ДЛС и карты на один континент.
Игра бесспорно наследник прошлой части в лучшем понимании этой фразы. Но после долгой игры в прошлую часть мне кажется разработчики пошли не в ту сторону.
По пунктам плюсы:
+ все плюсы прошлой части, а их немало, это и ивенты, и крафт и Лор.
+ больше врагов
+ появились биомы, со своими ивентами, расами и ресурсами
+ появилась торговля, нормальное взаимодействие с поселениями НПС
+ можно поставить свою деревню где удобно
+ новая боевка, хотя мне и старя нравилась
+ можно играть детьми и качать их пока не повзрослеют
+ вода, ивенты, квесты и места на воде
Минусы:
- игра очень растянута, это основной и главный минус, этому помогают следующие пункты
- убрали прирост детей в полях, заместь этого они рождаются, но это происходит ОЧЕНЬ редко, итог - вам постоянно не хватает людей
- все еще дебильное поднятие уровня, когда воину дают на выбор совершенно ему не нужные навыки/характеристики
- ресурсы, их стало больше, это наверное плюс. НО последние тиры ресурсов добыть собирателями нельзя, их можно только скрафтить из нижнего тира, в итоге ресурсов всегда не хватает, нужно прослеживать дурацкую цепочку от верхнего тира, сколько тебе надо скрафтить предыдущего в 2-х вариантах. Заранее не накрафтишь, т.к. эти ресы нужны и для соседнего верхнего тира. В общем возня та еще, из-за этого крафт очень растянут
- даже имея ресурсы высшего тира последний вариант оружия скрафтить в высшем качестве нельзя, только надеяться на удачный крафт (лотарея)
- есть неудобства в интерфейсе
- одни ивенты очень часто повторяются, другие ты никогда и не увидишь (игра показывает процент увиденного в игре)

Игру я все же посоветую, тем кто не играл в первую часть может зайти. Да и на пару заходов меня хватило. 
Дальше мотивации продолжать нет, открывать карточки? На них надо очень много очков, бонусы от богов так-себе. Так как ресов всегда не хватает надо брать бога на добычу, но это мое личное мнение.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982941809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1706723692}
review:
The game just came out and it's still a little unpolished, and definitely an early access game. But even as an early access game it offers so much more than traditional strategy RPGs.

Edit: Getting to the point where I am pretty disappointed with the Dev's decisions and can no longer recommend the game.

It's weird but I am not enjoying it as much as I did when it first came out in beta. You still can't get to "the "endgame". It's almost impossible to reach the point of researching max tier resources even 600+ turns in while keeping up on buildings and equipment. So instead you "rush" through the game by letting half your party die on the final fights because you are bored and the game slows to a crawl.

And speaking of slowing the game to a crawl, the rest of the game does not do much better. You get too many units to micromanage that are useless other than being mules or perma-naked gathering/research/cooking slaves. It's not even worth it to equip these guys because you need to use all of your available resources on "cooking" high level materials so it's not really worth having useless people have anything but random drops. And even equiping those is tedious 500+ turns in.

The developers decided that this game(unlike Thea 1) would be based around small groups of units and 2-4 units would make up the entire fight. This is fine early but the game has a huge surplus of units so you end up with groups of 20-30 units and only enough equipment to outfit 10. It's dumb to have 20 naked characters walking around as pack mules with your party but you can't let them go off because that takes more micromanagement and doubles the length of the end turn spam. It's just tedious and no longer fun after a certain point

 Worse, the game keeps getting slower. There has been 1 update in in the last few months that has increased the speed of the game. There have been countless changes to make the game slower(Smaller gathering radius, nerfs to gathering, multiple nerfs to weapons and player characters, etc).I'd say a good 60%(Midgame)-90%(late game) of my turns are now  simply me passing turns endlessly while I wait to gather some material that isn't even relevant in the grand scheme of things compared to random item drops. 

TL,DR: I rant about game being slower every patch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991728980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1543603820}
review:
Haven't played for a long now, but seeing how there are not many reviews I couldn't help but hop out of the game and write one quickly. The game is an atmospheric mix of 4x with a "choose your own adventure" game. There are plenty (and I mean *plenty* to a fault at times) special events that pop up during exploration and allow you to make meaningful story choices. I say to a fault because sometimes I just want to gather stuff needed for a building but then a decision I made earlier catches up with me and I have to deal with unexpected guests in the camp. Still got to figure out how card combat works (haven't played the first game) so I will write more on that later. 

So far I haven't encountered any bugs but it's Early Access so I expect plenty. The game has a bug reporting widget which is a thoughtful feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032183431', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 48689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 11582, 'last_played': 1711484768}
review:
Пока все здорово. Очень обратила на себя внимание музыкальная тема на старте. Изменений огромное количество. Загрузки стали почти мгновенными. Интерфейс из нарисованного на коленке стал "настоящим", красивым. Сбылась мечта игроков в первую "Тею": теперь при повышении уровня персонажей игрок выбирает один из трех предложенных переметров. Бои и испытания теперь гораздо интересней. Место для деревни можно выбирать. В начале наш бог-куратор вручает отряду полученное в конце первой части космическое семечко, и с его помощию мы строим деревню. Но, так как крафтом теперь можно заниматься и во временном лагере, деревни может и не быть вообще, можно оставить племя кочевым.  Механика строительства зданий и создания предметов тоже претерпела серьезные изменения. Теперь каждый материал имеет характеристику "качество", и игрок волен перед началом строительства "покупать" на очки, равные общей сумме качеств материала особенности будущего строения или вещи. 
Очень порадовала кнопка "дизайн" в меню крафта. Она позволяет проектировать веши (и смотреть их характеристики) из любых ресурсов (отсутствующих, не открытых). 
Серьезные изменения коснулись оружия. Во-первых, дистанционное оружие (луки, арбалеты, волшебные палочки и метательные копья) стало действительно оружием и позволяет вести бой с удаленной позиции (а не поднимает один из параметров, как это было раньше). Во-вторых, большая его часть дает не прибавку к силе/ловкости, а множитель. Таким образом, ребенок или крестьянин, экипированный вундервафлей, не станет убийцей великанов. 
Из недоделок пока больше всего неприятностей доставляет ситуация с очками исследований. Производство предметов и возведение построек их больше не приносит, так что о необходимости постоянного крафта и принципе "show must go on" можно забыть. Дает их строение "школа" (вроде как исправили в последнем патче, до этого не давала). Ну, и скудное количество колбочек можно получить в результате выполнения заданий и событий.   
Ключ был получен от разработчиков через сайт Twow.ru, так что мое более подробное ревью игры (в состоянии раннего доступа) со скриншотами и видео можно прочитать там http://twow.ru/forum/index.php?/articles/review/thea-2-the-shattering-vyzhivaem-krasivo/

review:
Summary: I’ve logged 400+ hours in the original Thea, it’s certainly in my top 5 games of all time. The second installment is shaping up to be an incredible successor. Since it was just released (and is early access) there are a fair amount of bugs. Thea 1 was a very streamlined and clean playing experience, so I have total faith that the bugs will be worked through quickly.  Dev team is very responsive and shows a deep, continuous investment in their games.

Pros:
Beautiful music with a diverse score
Lots of fun and novel character portraits
Expansive crafting system
Challenging encounters
Engaging story with interesting Slavic Mythology

Cons:
Just released EA means plenty of bugs!  Thankfully they have been addressing quickly – there has been a patch every day since Kickstarter EA release!
No way to currently tune the difficulty. Challenges can ramp up very quickly and overwhelm you

author: {'steamid': '76561198030968205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 26872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9142, 'last_played': 1685943555}
review:
Backed this in kickstarter as i totally loved Thea the awakening . 
this is just a review of the early access version and i will keep it brief.

The developers have been very consitant in patches updates (every day or so ) and listening to communtiy feed back . This means you will have to opt out of updates if you dont want to restart every day or so. But it does mean it just keeps getting bettter.

I totally love this game you start with a rag tag group of people a mixture of character types that you can mostly choose at the start of the game..  you have to explore pretty much at free will harvesting resources trying to stay alive. It can be hard at first glance but it only takes a little time to get the hang of the system . however mastering it can be brutal you might bump into a dragon or large group of bandits early on.. but at least you get a flee option normally.. the is no greater feeling than when you build your first settlement , raise your first kid to adulthood.. or defeat that beast that before you had to run from.
the are quest to guide you which you can choose to ignore  and nice crafting system and i really love character leveling.
i would gladly give the game to any of my 4X or roleplaying buddies for x-mas etc 
WARNING YOU MIGHT NEED A FRIEND TO REMIND YOU TO GO TO BED ONCE YOU START PLAYING
